Company Name: GERMAN EUROPEAN SCHOOL SINGAPORE (DEUTSCHE EUROPAEISCHE SCHULE SINGAPUR)
Job Description: The German European School Singapore (GESS) is looking for experienced University and Career Guidance Counsellor, commencing 1 August 2025.  The role focuses on providing guidance and personalized support to students, especially European Section students in Grades 8-12.  Responsibilities:  Provide comprehensive guidance on university admissions and career planning, including university selection, application processes, standardized testing, and scholarship opportunities for European and German students. Conduct workshops and seminars for students and parents on university admissions and career preparation. Offer ongoing support post-results day and assist students in navigating next steps in their academic and career pathways. Stay up to date on university admissions requirements, career trends, and organize relevant events to integrate college and career planning into the curriculum. Maintain detailed student records and generate reports on progress, keeping students and parents informed. Collaborate with the High School teams to implement policies and strategies that support career exploration and university admissions preparation. Contribute to the management and development of a centralized Career and University Counselling Microsite. Stay informed about changes in the higher education landscape to provide students with the latest information on admissions criteria and industry requirements.  Requirements:  Relevant qualification/certification in university & careers counselling or at least 4 years of experience in a secondary school or student environment. Knowledge of university admissions processes in the US, UK, Europe (non-UK), and Australia. Experience with international students and culturally responsive practices. Strong communication, presentation, and technology skills. Experience with German university admissions processes and German language skills are advantageous to liaise with German speaking students, colleagues and parents. Flexible approach, willingness to work beyond school hours, and meet deadlines.  Keen to collaborate and share your specialist expertise, you will be a fitting ambassador for the school. You will communicate with confidence across diverse audiences and situations, using your expertise to build strong relationships across the GESS community.  Our School The German European School Singapore (GESS) is a multi-lingual, not-for-profit, German international school in Singapore with a distinct European flavour. As an accredited ‘Excellent German School Abroad’, the German Section of GESS offers all major German school leaving certificates.  Our European Section offers tuition in English for students from grade 1 - 12 across all three IB programmes (the PYP, the MYP and the IB Diploma Programme) as an authorised IB World School.  Children aged 2 years onwards can enroll in our Preschool where children are following the PYP programme in German-speaking, English-speaking or bilingual groups. In addition to an outstanding academic education, GESS strives to teach students community values such as respect, openness and diversity.  To Apply We offer an exciting working environment in an international and cooperative team. Your application should include a letter of application and your complete resume. Client Interaction:    - Collaborate with clients to understand their financial goals, risk tolerance, and investment preferences.    - Provide regular updates on portfolio performance and recommend adjustments based on client objectives.  4.  Asset Allocation:    - Assist in developing and implementing asset allocation strategies tailored to clients' investment objectives.    - Monitor and rebalance portfolios to ensure alignment with strategic asset allocation targets.  5.  Due Diligence:    - Conduct due diligence on potential investment opportunities, assessing financial statements, management       teams, and market conditions.    - Prepare comprehensive reports outlining investment recommendations and associated risks.  6.  Regulatory Compliance:    - Ensure compliance with relevant financial regulations and internal policies.    - Stay informed about changes in regulatory requirements and industry best practices.  7.  Performance Reporting:    - Generate and present performance reports to clients, highlighting investment returns, risks, and market conditions.    - Analyze performance metrics and make recommendations for optimizing portfolio performance.  8.  Relationship Management:    - Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with clients, addressing inquiries and providing exceptional service.    - Collaborate with internal teams, including financial advisors and risk management, to enhance client satisfaction.  9.  Technology Utilization:    - Leverage financial software and tools for data analysis, risk assessment, and portfolio management.    - Stay current on advancements in financial technology to enhance operational efficiency.  10. Continual Learning:     - Engage in ongoing professional development to stay current on industry trends, investment strategies, and financial products.     - Pursue relevant certifications to enhance knowledge and credibility in the field.    Qualifications:  - Bachelor's degree, Local Diploma, A Levels - Strong analytical and quantitative skills. - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Job Title: Senior Manager /  Associate Director, Advisory and Impact
Job Description: Position Overview: The Senior Manager / Associate Director for the Advisory and Impact team will lead strategic advisory services, drive impact measurement initiatives, and oversee the development and management of ACF impact funds. Crucial to this role is building and strengthening relationships with social impact partners, donors, and other stakeholders, while ensuring effective and efficient management of the organisation’s impact funds. The Senior Manager / Associate Director will also play a critical role in the design, implementation, and evaluation of impact-driven projects, providing thoughtful guidance to ensure that advisory services are impactful and aligned with a donor’s or organisation’s funding objectives.  Key Responsibilities:  Impact Fund Management:  Oversee the development and management of impact funds, working closely with fund Champion and issue experts to define the strategic approach, identify and outreach to partners, determine fund allocation, and track performance against agreed impact goals Identify and source relevant issue experts to inform fund development, leveraging ACF board members, donors and network as appropriate Liaise with internal teams and external partners to ensure impact funds are effectively deployed, monitored, and evaluated Develop operating models to ensure financial sustainability of impact funds Identify opportunities to maximise impact investments and leverage additional funding to support initiatives Design and implement impact measurement frameworks and work with partners to track and report agreed indicators and outcomes  Advisory Services:  Lead strategic grant advisory engagements with donors, providing recommendations and guidance on thematic issue areas, programme design, and impact assessment Develop and nurture relationships with external stakeholders, including social impact partner and donors, ensuring alignment with organisational priorities and objectives Provide insights on emerging trends in social sector initiatives and philanthropic practices  Team Leadership and Collaboration:  Manage and mentor a team of associates and interns, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and high performance Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including donor development and marketing, to ensure the integration of advisory and impact strategies into organisational workflows Lead capacity-building initiatives, providing training and resources to internal team members on best practices for impact measurement and advisory services.  Reporting and Communication:  Prepare high-quality reports, presentations, and proposals for donors, partners, and other key stakeholders, ensuring clarity, impact, and alignment with organisational goals Represent the organisation at external events, conferences, and forums, sharing insights and building the organisation’s profile in the sector   Requirements   A master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., International Development, Business Administration, Social Impact, Economics). At least 7-10 years of experience in regional grant advisory services, impact measurement, and/or programme management within the social impact or development sector Strong experience in managing relationships with donors, partners, and other stakeholders Experience in leading teams and working in cross-functional settings Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships at all levels Experience in impact measurement methodologies and frameworks Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines, with a results-driven mindset Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel and PowerPoint; experience with impact measurement tools is a plus Passion for driving positive social change through collaboration and building trusted relationships Creative, adaptable mindset, willing to take on challenges and work in a fast-paced environment

Company Name: GERMAN EUROPEAN SCHOOL SINGAPORE (DEUTSCHE EUROPAEISCHE SCHULE SINGAPUR)
Job Description: The German European School Singapore (GESS) is looking for expressions of interest for an experienced Middle School EAL Teacher for Grades 6-8.  In your teaching commitment at GESS, you will need to take on the following responsibilities where you will be expected to:  · Develop a strong relationship with all parents and students · Be a role model who mentors and guides students to ensure they meet their full potential · Actively review student assessment data, including academic, behavioral and social/emotional, to set learning goals, develop student agency and put in place interventions to ensure successful learning of each individual  Responsibilities  - Assist with the development and implementation of the GESS EAL Foundations programme including English Language acquisition and development for beginning EAL students and supporting their development in other subjects, and EAL after school support for Grades 8-10 students - Prepare, teach and assess students in the GESS EAL Foundation programme - Collaborate regularly with EAL, SSS team and leadership - Communicate with parents - Support teaching staff to deliver a high-quality MYP Programme with tier 1 in-class supports - Develop, update and maintain curriculum documents - Administer WIDA and OPT assessments and share accommodations based on student specific levels  Experience and Qualifications  - Recognised teaching qualification (minimum B.Ed or PGCE equivalent) - Tertiary educational background - At least 2 years of EAL teaching experience - Knowledge and understanding of content and language integrated learning methods preferable - Articulate and effective written and oral communication in English - Ability to work independently and as part of a team - Willingness to adapt to and embrace a new school environment - Willingness to contribute and champion educational change that supports best practices and improves student learning  Professional Expertise  - Cognitive Activation / Pedagogical Subject Knowledge: The teacher has a deep understanding of the curriculum, pedagogy, subject content, and the developmental needs of students to effectively provide rich learning experiences. - Classroom Management: The teacher understands the importance of establishing routines and procedures and providing a safe, supportive, student-centred learning environment. - Formative Assessment: The teacher can effectively use differentiated assessment tools and strategies and understands how to make accommodations for individual students that drive learning forward. - Student Well-being & Safeguarding: The teacher is a caretaker of the student’s social health and emotional well-being. They support healthy peer relationships and interactions. At the same time, they are guiding individual emotional, well-being and social development. - Professionalism: The teacher is committed to professional ethics, international-mindedness, and the school’s mission; collaborates and communicates appropriately and takes responsibility for professional growth that enhances student learning.  Keen to collaborate and share your specialist expertise, you will be a fitting ambassador for the school. You will communicate with confidence across diverse audiences and situations, using your expertise to build strong relationships across the GESS community.  Our School The German European School Singapore (GESS) is a multi-lingual, not-for-profit, German international school in Singapore with a distinct European flavour. As an accredited ‘Excellent German School Abroad’, the German Section of GESS offers all major German school leaving certificates.  Our European Section offers tuition in English for students from grade 1 - 12 across all three IB programmes (the PYP, the MYP and the IB Diploma Programme) as an authorised IB World School.  Children aged 2 years onwards can enroll in our Preschool where children are following the PYP programme in German-speaking, English-speaking or bilingual groups. In addition to an outstanding academic education, GESS strives to teach students community values such as respect, openness and diversity.  To Apply We offer an exciting working environment in an international and cooperative team. Your application should include a letter of application and your complete resume. Please indicate your reasons for applying for the position.  Our Selection Process At GESS we adhere to fair employment practices that consist of hiring practices that are fair, merit-based and non-discriminatory.  We are committed to providing a world class, safe, happy environment in which children and young people are able to thrive and learn. We are committed to safeguarding and child protection as we promote the welfare of all our pupils irrespective of race, ability, religion, gender or culture.  All post holders are subject to appropriate vetting procedures including satisfactory reference and background checks and the offer of employment will be subject to the completion of these.  Please note, that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Environmental Control Officer (ECO) cum Safety Coordinator  Primary Objective Ensure construction projects comply with environmental regulations and minimize environmental impact. Plan, manage, and ensure workplace safety and health compliance Familiar with NEA, MOM regulations and WSH Coordinator duties Advise and act on measures to improve workplace safety and health Conduct WSH compliance an daily inspection of project activities  Key Activities  1. Environmental Compliance and Monitoring  Ensure all construction activities comply with local environmental laws, regulations, and project-specific requirements. Monitor site activities to identify potential environmental risks and implement mitigation measures. Conduct regular site inspections to ensure proper implementation of environmental control measures.  2. Waste and Pollution Management  Oversee the proper handling, storage, and disposal of construction waste materials. Implement pollution prevention measures, including noise, dust, and water pollution controls. Monitor wastewater discharge and ensure compliance with discharge permits.  3. Environmental Documentation  Prepare and maintain environmental management plans (EMP), reports, and checklists. Submit periodic environmental compliance reports to authorities and project stakeholders. Maintain records of environmental incidents and the corrective actions taken.  4. Training and Awareness  Conduct training sessions for site staff on environmental best practices and compliance requirements. Raise awareness among workers about environmental protection and sustainability.  5. Liaison with Authorities and Stakeholders  Act as the point of contact with environmental authorities and regulatory bodies during inspections or audits. Work with project managers, engineers, and subcontractors to resolve environmental issues.  6. Incident Response and Risk Mitigation  Respond to environmental incidents promptly and implement corrective actions. Conduct root cause analyses of environmental non-compliance or accidents.  7. Sustainable Practices  Promote the use of eco-friendly construction materials and techniques. Advocate for sustainable practices in resource use, such as energy and water conservation.  8. Reporting and Advising  Provide regular updates to senior management on environmental performance and areas for improvement. Advise on potential environmental risks and recommend preventive measures.

Job Description: As the Business Development Manager, your primary responsibility will be identifying new business opportunities and developing relationships with current and potential clients. You will lead the sales effort, manage the sales process, and close deals. Additionally, you will collaborate closely with other departments to develop and implement strategies that align with our business goals.  Primary Responsibilities:  Develop and implement comprehensive business strategies and initiatives that drive the overall business performance, while exploring and expanding into new markets Formulate and execute strategic plans to identify, target, and secure new corporate clients and partners Actively engage with potential referrers and prospects to generate a strong pipeline of new business opportunities Proactively follow up with prospects to establish and maintain relationships and convert them into long-term clients Build and maintain a detailed database of prospective projects and client information to effectively manage and prioritize sales activities Develop a deep understanding of the company's offerings to identify profitable business opportunities and provide insights for strategic decision-making Support the preparation of sales and marketing materials, including proposals, presentations, and other related documents Participate in trade shows, industry events, and partner conferences to gather market intelligence, provide recommendations, and improve the company's visibility in the market Collaborate with internal departments, external business partners, agencies, and consultants to ensure client requirements are met or exceeded  Requirements  Bachelor’s degree in related discipline Proven track record in business development and corporate sales. Having experience in Business Grant application experience will be an advantage. Strong communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills Excellent organizational and project management skills Fluency in English and Chinese with the ability to conduct business meetings and build strong relationships with our Chinese-speaking clients.

Job Description: We’re searching for a Network Engineer to be part of our diverse team of talent here at NCS!  If you believe in going above and beyond, want to exemplify the best, and wish to bring people and technology together like never before, then we would love to have a conversation with you!  What will you do? · Responsible for the infrastructure network design, implementation, testing, security, managing and maintenance of proposed system · Work closely with Team Leader to meet system delivery milestones · Provide technical documentation support to Project & Solutions Teams, as well as hand over as-built system documentation to Maintenance support team · Engage with back-line support and/or with vendor’s support to diagnose and rectify technical problems. · Assist in day-to-day operation of the System Delivery team · Carry out other technical related duties that may be required.  The ideal candidate should possess:  Good understanding of network system, network architecture, routing, switching, firewall and security Good interpersonal and communication skills to interact effectively at all levels Proficient in performing network analysis and troubleshooting using network and protocol analyzers Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science/Information Technology/Engineering or relevant field with network certification in CCNA/CCNP/CCIE Minimum 3-5 years of experience in configuring and administering routers and switches (e.g. Cisco routers and switches, etc), firewall products (e.g. CheckPoint, Forcepoint, etc.), F5 Load Balancers, AAA, NTP, IPS  What you might also need to have:  24 x 7 standby support and/or Shift work schedule

Responsibilities:  1.  Portfolio Analysis:    - Conduct in-depth analysis of investment portfolios, assessing performance metrics and risk factors.    - Utilize financial techniques to evaluate potential investment opportunities.  2.  Market Research:    - Stay abreast of financial market trends, economic indicators, and industry developments.    - Analyze market data to provide insights into investment strategies and potential risks.  3.  Client Interaction:    - Collaborate with clients to understand their financial goals, risk tolerance, and investment preferences.    - Provide regular updates on portfolio performance and recommend adjustments based on client objectives.  4.  Asset Allocation:    - Assist in developing and implementing asset allocation strategies tailored to clients' investment objectives.    - Monitor and rebalance portfolios to ensure alignment with strategic asset allocation targets.  5.  Due Diligence:    - Conduct due diligence on potential investment opportunities, assessing financial statements, management       teams, and market conditions.    - Prepare comprehensive reports outlining investment recommendations and associated risks.  6.  Regulatory Compliance:    - Ensure compliance with relevant financial regulations and internal policies.    - Stay informed about changes in regulatory requirements and industry best practices.  7.  Performance Reporting:    - Generate and present performance reports to clients, highlighting investment returns, risks, and market conditions.    - Analyze performance metrics and make recommendations for optimizing portfolio performance.  8.  Relationship Management:    - Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with clients, addressing inquiries and providing exceptional service.    - Collaborate with internal teams, including financial advisors and risk management, to enhance client satisfaction.  9.  Technology Utilization:    - Leverage financial software and tools for data analysis, risk assessment, and portfolio management.    - Stay current on advancements in financial technology to enhance operational efficiency.  10. Continual Learning:     - Engage in ongoing professional development to stay current on industry trends, investment strategies, and financial products.     - Pursue relevant certifications to enhance knowledge and credibility in the field.    Qualifications:  - Bachelor's degree, Local Diploma, A Levels - Strong analytical and quantitative skills. - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Dulwich College (Singapore) is seeking a talented Events Manager.  The post holder will play a vital role in planning, coordinating, and executing high-quality events and programmes at the College, and will ensure that all events align with the school's vision and values, meet safety and safeguarding standards, and foster community engagement. The Events Manager will collaborate closely with academic and business support staff to deliver seamless and impactful experiences for students, parents, and stakeholders.  Taking on a project leadership role, the Events Manager works on College-wide events with domain owners to manage and coordinate all aspects, from strategy to execution. Detail oriented and insightful, the Events Manager should possess excellent communication and people management skills and should be able to rally team members to implement events within tight schedules and stipulated budgets. They must be confident at dealing with people at all levels of the organisation and must be able to multitask numerous projects at the same time and confidently manage multi-team meetings. Strong project management skills sets and an equally strong sense of initiative and ownership are the basic competencies required for this role.  Duties and responsibilities include:  Event Management, Strategy and Delivery  Event management of Whole College events, from planning and outlining event execution, managing resources, budgets and timelines, development of detailed program content and creating comprehensive itineraries. Provide financial oversight for event budgets and prepare regular reports on expenditures and outcomes. Lead and liaise effectively with all stakeholders across the College (including the College Leadership Team, Heads of Department, colleagues, parents and students), to plan and execute internal and external College events across each academic year. Collaborate closely with the AV Manager to utilise the available space in the College effectively. Conduct surveys with event participants and other stakeholders as appropriate. Review and analyse events and produce appropriate data, usage reports and feedback to ensure continuous improvement. Communicate feedback and recommendations through appropriate channels. Build relationships and work closely with vendors such as the onsite caterer, ICT and AV teams, operations, security, and academic staff. Provide strategic oversight and guidance for the management of College facility rentals, ensuring efficient processes and profitable margins. Support the cultivation of vendor relationships to establish and maintain a strong portfolio of high-quality renters. Coordination and management of annual events calendar together with the Events and Projects Officer and the Executive Assistant to the Head of College.  Vendor Management  Source, negotiate, and manage contracts with vendors, ensuring high-quality services and cost-effectiveness. Act as the primary liaison for all vendors, including caterers, AV technicians, decorators, and transportation providers. Oversee vendor performance and ensure compliance with contractual agreements and safeguarding standards.  Risk Assessment and Compliance  Conduct comprehensive risk assessments for all events, including camps and off-site activities, ensuring alignment with health and safety regulations. Ensure all event activities comply with the school’s safeguarding policies and government regulations. Develop contingency plans to address potential challenges or emergencies during events.  Collaboration and Stakeholder Engagement  Work with stakeholders to align events with the school’s branding and objectives. Partner with academic staff to design events that support student learning, engagement, and well-being. Provide guidance and advisory services as the school’s in-house events agency, ensuring adherence to best practices and established protocols.  Administrative Responsibilities  Provide administrative support for the Events unit. Assume the role of Event Lead for designated events, taking full ownership of the planning and execution. Organize and manage events with responsibilities for all administrative and logistical tasks, including:Liaising with speakers and guests. Arranging flights, accommodations, and transportation. Coordinating with vendors and managing contracts. Managing event budgets and ensuring financial accountability. Conducting rehearsals and virtual test calls where required.  Monitor the progress of event planning and execution to ensure all milestones are achieved. Ensure compliance with policies and regulations while meeting all administrative and operational requirements.  Holiday Camps Partnership  Serve as the primary liaison between the Holiday Camp provider and Dulwich College (Singapore), overseeing the development of each camp programme, coordinating its promotion through internal channels, and acting as the key contact for the provider during the delivery of each camp.  The successful candidate will have:  A Bachelor’s degree in Event Management, Hospitality, Business Administration, or a related field, or equivalent. A minimum of 3-5 years of experience in event planning and management, preferably in an educational or international organisation. Experience of negotiating vendor or supplier contracts and managing service provision. Experience of managing projects cross-departmentally. Experience working in an international environment would be desirable. Experience of coordinating with community groups in the organising of events. Strong leadership and project management skills with the ability to oversee multiple events simultaneously. Excellent organisational skills, and the ability to collaborate across the organisation at all levels. Strong communication skills and the ability to communicate effectively in English, both verbally and in writing. Outstanding customer service skills, and an attitude of ‘going the extra mile’ to meet customer needs and expectations. Ability to manage multiple tasks and work under pressure to meet agreed deadlines and goals. Ability to work autonomously with minimum supervision, managing own workload to ensure the highest standards of performance and customer service provision are achieved. Strong IT skills in using Microsoft Office. Flexible approach to work, and the ability to be agile in the requirements of planning and delivering events.  Dulwich College (Singapore) is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of all the students in our care and expects all applicants to share this commitment. We follow safe recruitment practices which are aligned to the recommendations of the International Task Force on Child Protection. We hold ourselves to a high standard of effective recruiting practices with specific attention to child protection.  All appointments are subject to an interview, identity checks, criminal record checks, social media checks, and successful references.  PEI Registration Number: 201027137D. Period of Registration: 09 January 2024 to 08 January 2028

Company Name: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
Job Description: Overview As a Senior / Radiographer, you are responsible for supervising, coaching and training radiographers and other staff members to render high quality imaging services. You may also be responsible for the routine management and administration of a modality/section within the department. Job Responsibilities Primary Responsibilities (80%)  Perform clinical duties in general radiography and at least one advanced imaging modality (CT / MRI / Ultrasound / Mammography / Breast Imaging / Interventional Radiology) Administer contrast media for radiological examinations, where required Oversee the smooth operations within his/her section of specialised area and ensure proper usage and care of equipment of the section at all times Ensure quality assurance programmes are implemented and observed as well as initiate system improvement within the section Adhere to safe work practices especially in radiation safety and infection control Conduct training and coaching of radiographers Render prompt and courteous service delivery to external and internal customers Handle difficult situations like patients’ complaints and queries within the department / section promptly and effectively Ensure efficient patient turnaround time per examination Plan, organise and prioritise assigned tasks such that all are completed effectively and on time Motivate and counsel team members on personal and work related issues. Build upon their strengths and help improve their weaknesses for desired results  Secondary Responsibilities (20%)  Maintain and upkeep a section with efficient work performance Collate and prepare statistical data of the section Ensure physical environment and ambience of work place adheres to corporate standards Perform any other duties as assigned by reporting officer/ HOD  Requirements  Allied Health Professions Council (AHPC) registration Recognised Degree or Diploma in Diagnostic Radiography 5 years specialised experience in Mammography / Breast Imaging / Ultrasound / CT / MRI / Interventional Radiology preferred. Exhibit strong leadership potential. Compassionate and good patient care Good interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills Customer and service oriented Computer skills in word processing, spreadsheet and presentation software  If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading. *Only Singapore Citizens and Singapore Permanent Residents may apply.

Job Description: NCS is a leading technology services firm that operates across the Asia Pacific region in over 20 cities, providing consulting, digital services, technology solutions, and more. We believe in harnessing the power of technology to achieve extraordinary things, creating lasting value and impact for our communities, partners, and people. Our diverse workforce of 13,000 has delivered large-scale, mission-critical, and multi-platform projects for governments and enterprises in Singapore and the APAC region. We’re searching for a Senior System Engineer to be part of our diverse team of talents here at NCS! If you believe in going above and beyond, want to exemplify the best, and wish to bring people and technology together like never before, then we would love to have a conversation with you! What we seek to accomplish together:  Perform team lead role and track the progress of operations work plan Organize and plan the maintenance activities with the team. Install and configure Windows, Linux servers, VM. Assist the IT Security Officer in evaluating the system and security patches. Apply security patches after obtaining the necessary approvals. Come up with the implementation plan and SOP whenever necessary Establish the backup procedures for the system and supervise the Operators to make sure that the backup procedures were followed. Respond to incidents/alerts and follow up on immediate resolution. Perform system housekeeping. Schedule and perform regular system maintenance. Manage the system resources. Monitor system performance. Review system audit logs after each exercise. Assist in maintaining the OCOE hardware and software inventory. Perform system health check. Assist in troubleshooting of any OCOE incidents. Perform OCOE system health check. Monitor the OCOE system during exercise. Update relevant sections in the Monthly Progress Report  A little bit about you:  At least a university degree in IT related field with minimum 3 years of relevant working experience on installation, configuration and administration of Windows and Linux. Working knowledge on monitoring system (e.g. Solarwinds Orion), CyberArk, EPP and backup system.  Technical Skills  Installation, configuration and administration of Windows and Linux. Scripting languages (Bash, PowerShell) Relevant certifications (e.g Advanced Windows Server Administration)  Security Focus:  Experience with security best practices and compliance frameworks Identity and access management experience  Soft Skills :  Good communication and inter-personal sills Problem-solving and analytical thinking Team collaboration Incident management and escalation handling  We are driven by our AEIOU beliefs—Adventure, Excellence, Integrity, Ownership, and Unity—and we seek individuals who embody these values in both their professional and personal lives. We are committed to our Impact: Valuing our clients, Growing our people, and Creating our future. Together, we make the extraordinary happen. Learn more about us at ncs.co and visit our LinkedIn career site. We handle all profiles with the highest level of confidentiality.

Job Title: Program Lead /  Manager- Biotech / 1 yr contract / upto 5k
Job Description: Job Title: Contract Staff Member – Program Lead/Manager – Biotech Leadership Program Development  Location: Singapore  Duration: 12 months (contract) Overview: We are seeking an experienced and motivated individual to join the Biomedical Sciences Industry Partnership Office on a contract basis. The primary responsibility will be to lead the design, development, coordination, and implementation of a Biotech Leadership Program targeted at local biotech C-suites and executive members. This program is designed to cultivate leadership and strategic capabilities in the local biotech industry through masterclass series and networking opportunities. Key Responsibilities: 1. Program Development and Coordination: o Design, develop and manage a masterclass series covering critical leadership topics for driving company growth. o Drive procurement and selection process to select a vendor to assist in the development of the series. o Collaborate with government agencies, industry experts, and selected vendor(s) to develop content tailored to the needs of biotech C-suites. o Act as the primary point of contact for the programme, ensuring clear communication of program objectives, schedules, and expectations. 2. Budget Management: o Plan and manage the program’s budget, ensuring effective resource allocation and alignment with project requirements. 3. Risk Management and Problem Solving: o Identify potential risks or challenges in program implementation and proactively develop solutions to address them. 4. Monitoring and Evaluation: o Develop and maintain program implementation timelines, milestones, and deliverables to ensure the timely progress of objectives. o Prepare reports and presentations to update stakeholders on program implementation progress and outcomes. Qualifications: · Bachelor's degree in a relevant field. Experience in the biotech industry or public sector, particularly with familiarity in biotech or healthcare, is a plus. · Strong organizational and project management skills, with experience in coordinating programs or initiatives. · Familiarity with research initiatives, leadership development, or collaborative projects in biotech or healthcare industry is a plus. · Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to engage diverse stakeholders, including senior leaders and experts. · A proactive and adaptable approach to problem-solving and achieving goals. Preferred Qualifications: · Knowledge of Singapore’s biotech industry landscape and its ecosystem. · Experience designing and implementing professional development programs for company leaders.  If you are what we are looking for & keen to apply, kindly send your resume (in MS word format) to Saru.Mehrotra@rmagroup.com.sg | 64941530  All Curriculum Vitaes will be treated with the strictest confidentiality. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.  Saru Mehrotra EA License No. 93C4403 EA Regn. No. R22108558

About Us  Established in 1972, Guardian Health & Beauty is Singapore’s Number 1 Health and Beauty retailer. With more than 127 stores nation-wide, it retails a comprehensive range of health & beauty products. Guardian has evolved from its pharmacy roots to a holistic one-stop solution for customers’ health and beauty needs. It continues to expand its products and service range to meet the redefinition of beauty by today’s customers – where health meets beauty.  With a strong health heritage, it has the largest network of award-winning pharmacists and a wide selection of health products. Professional services such as patient-care counselling, dispensary services, beauty and personal care solutions are offered at stores as a convenient one-stop for health and beauty. Guardian also operates its online store with more than 9,000 products available and offers the “Click & Collect” services. For more information, please visit www.guardian.com.sg. Follow Guardian Health & Beauty on Facebook, Instagram, Telegram, Youtube and TikTok.  Guardian Health & Beauty is a Progressive Wage (PW) mark accredited company.  The Role  Provide total patient care services to patients through interventions, follow-ups and lifestyle modification service so thatpatients’ needs are met and that Guardian is seen as an outstanding community pharmacy Ensure dispensary operates efficiently and meet standards of key control indicators in area of housekeeping, inventory, record maintenance, etc Undertake the role of a preceptor to be responsible for the clinical training of pre-registration pharmacists or interns so that they acquire the knowledge required for their day to day duties Monitor daily sales trends of pharmacy related categories – Rx, OTC, Vitamins, Homecare – and formulate action plans to counter competition and threats so as to safeguard sales growth and contribution To liaise and collaborate with partners (eg Singapore Cancer Society, Health Promotion Board etc) plan and organize pharmaceutical services and profile Guardian’s standings as a leading community pharmacy chain To play an active role in the various chapters in the Pharmaceutical Society of Singapore Support Clinical Pharmacists in outreach projects and ensure reasonable participations from fellow pharmacists  About You  Bachelor of Science (Pharmacy) Must be registered with the Singapore Pharmacy Board Candidates with extensive relevant experience may be considered for senior positions  Benefits  Team Member Discount Subsidized Medical and Dental Benefits Training Opportunities Career Advancement

Job Description: Join a team trusted by over more than 85,000 satisfied customers, boasting top-rated 5-star reviews on both Google and Facebook. We are a leading beauty brand in Singapore which provide great employment benefits and good career growth.  Beauty Consultant *Immediate Vacancies*  Basic Salary: Up to S$3,800 (depends on experience) Salary: Up to S$15K (uncapped commission + monthly allowance) AWS Bonus Bonus 2 times a year Annual leave up to 21 days Medical and Insurance Coverage Central working location Next to MRT Station Meals Provided Family Oriented Work Place Environment Exclusive Staff Benefits on our aesthetic treatments Career Progression to Outlet Manager  As a Beauty Consultant at Mirage Aesthetic, you will be the face of our brand, offering expert advice and personalized recommendations to our customers. Your primary role will be to drive sales by understanding customer needs, demonstrating product benefits, and creating an outstanding shopping experience.  Key Responsibilities:  Greet and assist customers in a friendly and professional manner, providing personalized beauty consultations and recommendations. Stay updated on the latest beauty trends, product launches, and brand promotions to offer accurate and relevant information to customers. Drive sales by effectively promoting products, conducting demonstrations, and upselling complementary items. Conduct in-store demonstrations and tutorials to showcase product benefits and application techniques. Assist with stock replenishment, monitor inventory levels, and ensure product displays are well-organized and visually appealing. Address customer inquiries and concerns promptly and professionally, ensuring a high level of customer satisfaction. Track sales performance, customer interactions, and feedback to help identify trends and areas for improvement.  Qualifications:  Sincere candidate who is looking for an opportunity to join an Award-Winning Aesthetic Centre Candidate must have at least 1 year of working experience in sales/beautician Previous experience in a beauty advisor or retail sales role preferred, but not required. Passion for beauty and skincare is essential. Able to converse in English and Chinese (in order to communicate with Chinese-speaking customers regarding queries and feedback). Self-motivated in achieving sales targets. Proven sales track record. Good interpersonal skill, service-oriented and able to multi-task. Good working attitude and enjoy meeting people. Job Summary: We are looking for a proactive and detail-oriented IT Security Analyst to support the IT Risk Management function within the organization. The role involves identifying, assessing, and mitigating risks related to IT infrastructure and operations, while ensuring compliance with key standards such as PCI DSS, ISO 27001, ISO 27701, PDPA, and other relevant regulations. The IT Risk Executive will assist in maintaining a secure and resilient IT environment, ensuring that the organization’s information systems are protected against potential risks.  Key Responsibilities:  Risk Identification & Assessment:Assist in identifying and evaluating IT risks across different business functions. Conduct regular risk assessments, security audits, and vulnerability assessments to detect potential risks or security gaps. Support in documenting and maintaining the organization’s risk register.  Compliance Support:Help ensure compliance with PCI DSS, ISO 27001, ISO 27701, PDPA, and other relevant regulations. Assist in preparing for internal and external IT audits by gathering evidence, managing documentation, and coordinating with relevant stakeholders. Monitor regulatory changes and support the implementation of necessary changes to meet compliance requirements.  Incident Monitoring & Reporting:Assist in tracking and responding to IT security incidents, coordinating with other teams to resolve issues. Maintain an incident log and report on security incidents and corrective actions taken.  Policy and Procedure Development:Support the development, review, and update of IT risk policies, procedures, and guidelines. Assist in ensuring that IT risk management policies are properly implemented and adhered to across the organization.  Training & Awareness:Assist in conducting IT risk awareness training for employees, ensuring they are informed about key security practices and compliance requirements. Help create awareness materials on best practices in information security and risk management.  Documentation & Reporting:Prepare and maintain reports on IT risk activities, audit findings, and compliance status for management and regulatory bodies. Assist in developing key metrics to track the effectiveness of IT risk management initiatives.  Vendor Risk Management:Help assess third-party vendor risks, ensuring that external partners comply with the organization’s IT security and risk management standards. Coordinate vendor reviews and help manage IT-related risks from external service providers.   Qualifications & Experience:  Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Cybersecurity, Risk Management, or a related field. 2-3 years of experience in IT risk management, cybersecurity, or related roles. Familiarity with industry standards such as PCI DSS, ISO 27001, ISO 27701, and PDPA regulations. Understanding of risk assessment methodologies and cybersecurity frameworks. Strong analytical skills with the ability to assess risks and propose mitigation strategies. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to work with cross-functional teams. Applicants must be Singaporean or Permanent Residents (PR)  To apply: pls click on below link: https://careers.cubepayment.com/jobs/Careers/616675000003799054/IT-Security-Analyst?source=CareerSite

Company Name: GERMAN EUROPEAN SCHOOL SINGAPORE (DEUTSCHE EUROPAEISCHE SCHULE SINGAPUR)
Job Description: The German European School Singapore (GESS) is looking for Primary School Homeroom Teacher position, with a start date of 1 August 2025.  Experience and Qualifications  Recognised teaching qualification (minimum B.Ed or PGCE equivalent) At least three years’ teaching experience Knowledge, understanding and teaching experience of the IB Primary Years Programme Articulate and effective written and oral communication in English Ability to work collaboratively, professionally and effectively within a team Experience working in an international school setting Willingness to adapt to and embrace a new school environment Willingness to contribute and champion educational change that supports best practice and improve student learning  Professional Expertise  Cognitive Activation / Pedagogical Subject Knowledge: The teacher has a deep understanding of the curriculum, pedagogy, subject content, and the developmental needs of students to effectively provide rich learning experiences. Classroom Management: The teacher understands the importance of establishing routines and procedures and providing a safe, supportive, student-centered learning environment. Formative Assessment: The teacher can effectively use differentiated assessment tools and strategies and understands how to make accommodations for individual students that drive learning forward. Student Well-being & Safeguarding: The teacher is a caretaker of the student’s social health and emotional well-being. They support healthy peer relationships and interactions. At the same time, they are guiding individual emotional, well-being and social development through the application of restorative practices. Professionalism: The teacher is committed to professional ethics, international-mindedness, and the school’s mission; collaborates and communicates appropriately and takes responsibility for professional growth that enhances student learning.   Keen to collaborate and share your specialist expertise, you will be a fitting ambassador for the school. You will communicate with confidence across diverse audiences and situations, using your expertise to build strong relationships across the GESS community.  Our School The German European School Singapore (GESS) is a multi-lingual, not-for-profit, German international school in Singapore with a distinct European flavour. As an accredited ‘Excellent German School Abroad’, the German Section of GESS offers all major German school leaving certificates.  Our European Section offers tuition in English for students from grade 1 - 12 across all three IB programmes (the PYP, the MYP and the IB Diploma Programme) as an authorised IB World School.  Children aged 2 years onwards can enroll in our Preschool where children are following the PYP programme in German-speaking, English-speaking or bilingual groups. In addition to an outstanding academic education, GESS strives to teach students community values such as respect, openness and diversity.  To Apply We offer an exciting working environment in an international and cooperative team. Your application should include a letter of application and your complete resume. Please indicate your reasons for applying for the position.  Our Selection Process At GESS we adhere to fair employment practices that consist of hiring practices that are fair, merit-based and non-discriminatory.  We are committed to providing a world class, safe, happy environment in which children and young people are able to thrive and learn. We are committed to safeguarding and child protection as we promote the welfare of all our pupils irrespective of race, ability, religion, gender or culture.  All post holders are subject to appropriate vetting procedures including satisfactory reference and background checks and the offer of employment will be subject to the completion of these.  Please note, that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Company Name: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
Job Description: Radiographer is responsible for the providing prompt diagnostic imaging services to the patient, ensuring patient safety and proper care of equipment. Assist Centre In-charge/ Senior or Principal Radiographer to guide and supervise junior and student radiographers when required. Job Responsibilities: • Perform general radiographic examinations and/or at least one of the area of specialty including mammography and/or ultrasound and/or Bone Mineral Densitometry. • Responsible for the safety and welfare of the patient. • Maintain a clean and safe environment; adhere to safe work practices especially in radiation safety and infection control. • Ensure proper usage and care for all equipment at the specific diagnostic centre. • Perform other administrative duties or ad-hoc quality departmental projects/activities as assigned by the reporting officer/ Lead Radiographer • Apply the ALARA principle for all procedures. • Responsible for general housekeeping of the allocated diagnostic centre. • Render prompt and courteous service delivery to external and internal customers. • Ensure efficient running and operations of their area of responsibility. • Assist the Radiographer-In-Charge / Senior or Principal Radiographer to ensure quality control procedures are performed diligently. • Ensure AHPC certification is achieved after one / two years depending on qualification(s). Job Requirements: Required Skills and Experience • Recognized degree in Diagnostic Radiography. • Professional Licence: R1 license with Centre for Radiation Protection and Nuclear Sciences, National Environment Agency. • Timely update and renewal of RI license. • Registration with Allied Health Professions Council. • Excellent written and verbal communication skills. • Strong organisational skills and able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. • Participate in continuous medical education and quality assurance programs as directed by Radiographer In-charge / Senior or Principal Radiographer. • Complete all assigned tasks in an organized and timely manner. • Service orientated and customer focused. Have a compassionate, caring and friendly attitude. • Able to work in a fast-paced environment and under pressure. • Effective communications and coaching skills. • Good team player. Preferred Skills and Experience • Mammography and ultrasound experience preferred. • Ability to communicate in vernacular languages • Knowledge of basic programming and advanced applications of MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint will be an added advantage. • Knowledge of NGEMR, Epic usage and RISPACS would be an additional advantage. (Please note that the working hours is on 5.5 days' work week)

NCS is a leading technology services firm that operates across the Asia Pacific region in over 20 cities, providing consulting, digital services, technology solutions, and more. We believe in harnessing the power of technology to achieve extraordinary things, creating lasting value and impact for our communities, partners, and people. Our diverse workforce of 13,000 has delivered large-scale, mission-critical, and multi-platform projects for governments and enterprises in Singapore and the APAC region.  The Client Delivery Lead ensures quality delivery of all projects contracted by the Client to NCS. He/She partners the Client Service Lead to bring together NCS offering from application, infrastructure, communication engineering and thought leadership to solve the key client’s most critical business needs in relation to delivery issues. He/she acts as the single point of contact for the key client on all service delivery matters. Beyond operational delivery matters, the CDL is also expected to:  Look for business opportunities to solve the client’s problems; Ideate solutions using technology and process changes; Create growth opportunities, taking into account the feasibility and sustainability of these opportunities and the core capabilities of NCS.  The CDL directs the right NCS team across different Lines of Business (LOBs) to drive profitable revenue, quality and customer satisfaction targets and ensure profitable delivery. He/she is accountable for the delivery services of the client’s account and needs to be involved in the delivery of the programs he/she is responsible for. The Client Delivery Lead has responsibilities that encompass managing business value, establishing and maintaining professional relationships with clients and stakeholders and leading multifunctional project teams.  The profile of a CDL is as follows: 1. Have deep industry domain expertise to better understand and frame the client’s context and business needs; 2. To be able to engage and advise clients on ideas or business solutions based on business needs/problems; 3. Project management and technology skills to lead and guide project teams across different Lines-of-Business (LOBs) on delivery issues.  What will you do?  Orchestrate externally and internally to create environment for successful delivery Assess high level conceptual design to ensure that what is sold can be delivered at the right margin Establish responsive business relationship with client including problem reporting and resolving highly complex service delivery issues when escalated Lead and manage the project delivery teams to ensure timely and quality delivery of services to the client in a cost-effective manner Identify, assess and resolve complex business problems/issues and propose alternative solutions Identify and manage issues and risks and act as an escalation point within the account Manage and monitor account level risk dollar and budget; control costs to ensure maximum achievement of revenue and margin Manage risk and impact of change requests and assist with service request of variation order negotiation Work closely with the Lines of Business on project capability gaps Manage sub-contractors and vendor contract escalated matters Act as the Solution Lead to ensure solution consistency and be the custodian of architecture  The ideal candidate should possess:  Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a related discipline PMP certification preferred 15 years or more experience in IT or ICT Consulting industry with 8 years or more in leadership positions Delivered projects relating to the specific domain or industry Process broad business acumen and deep industry knowledge, and to use this knowledge to develop/enhance client relationships Consulting practitioner preferred Proven track record in assuming overall responsibility and managing multi-million dollars projects in key client industry Process ‘hands-on’ knowledge, vast exposure and wealth of experience within vendor and user environment, coupled with a driven and self-motivated personality. Experience in managing measured productivity-driven operations or teams Consulting practitioner Good communication skills Understand and ability to apply social style techniques to manage stakeholders Client focused with strong organizational and project management skills Ability to lead multiple teams  We are driven by our AEIOU beliefs—Adventure, Excellence, Integrity, Ownership, and Unity—and we seek individuals who embody these values in both their professional and personal lives. We are committed to our Impact: Valuing our clients, Growing our people, and Creating our future.  Together, we make the extraordinary happen.  Learn more about us at ncs.co and visit our LinkedIn career site.

Civil Construction Manager  Site Management - 6 days work   Primary roles   Plan, prioritize and manage assigned projects, involved in the areas of pre-planning, budgeting, resources allocation, contract negotiation, drawings submission, progress claim, and worker coordination, to ensure that the team’s resources are used effectively and project deadlines are met. Supervise construction site personnel and subcontractors, client & consultant, attend weekly project progress meetings, and monitor compliance with building and safety codes and regulations. Ensuring the timely and cost-effective completion of construction projects.   Key Activities  Determine and define scope of work and deliverables, manage construction schedule and activities Assess project estimations and budgets, inspect existing structures, create design plans, and review potential safety issues Responsible for negotiating the contracts of subcontractors, communicating with inspectors and architects, meeting with construction managers, and coordinating the delivery of materials with vendors. Collaborating with engineers, architects, designers and subcontractors to determine the specifications of the project Obtaining permits and licenses from appropriate authorities Determine needed resources (manpower, equipment and materials) from start to finish with attention to budgetary limitations Plan all construction operations and schedule intermediate phases to ensure deadlines will be met Project Planning & Scheduling Develop and maintain a detailed project schedule, coordinating with subcontractors and suppliers to ensure timelines are met. Plan and implement efficient workflows to avoid delays and improve productivity. Adjust schedules as needed, considering unforeseen circumstances or changes in project scopes   Risk Management Identify potential risks and develop strategies to mitigate them. Conduct risk assessments, create risk management plans, and implement risk response strategies to minimize the impact of risks on project outcomes.  Team Management Assemble and lead project teams, assigning tasks, and responsibilities to team members based on their skills and expertise. Provide clear direction and guidance to team members, facilitate effective communication, and promote collaboration among team members.  Schedule Management Develop project schedules, defining tasks, dependencies, and timelines. Monitor progress, track milestones, and identify any deviations from the planned schedule. If necessary, adjust keep the project on track.  Quality Assurance Ensure that project deliverables meet the required quality standards. Define quality criteria, establish quality control processes, and conduct regular inspections and reviews to monitor and improve the project's quality.  Reporting and Documentation Responsible for generating regular progress reports and status updates for stakeholders. Document project activities, decisions, and outcomes to create a comprehensive project record.  Stakeholder Management Identify project stakeholders and establish effective communication channels with them. Engage stakeholders throughout the project, manage their expectations, and address any concerns or issues that may arise.  Change Management Handle changes that occur during the project lifecycle. Assess change requests, evaluate their impact on the project's scope, timeline, and budget, and implement appropriate change management procedures.  Continuous Improvement Evaluate project performance and conduct lessons learned sessions to identify areas for improvement. Use feedback and insights gained from completed projects to enhance project management processes and practices within the organization.

Role: Electrical Engineer Permanent Position Location: Central, Singapore (Outram)  Key Responsibilities: · Perform daily, weekly, and monthly maintenance on the system, including testing, inspection, adjustment, and calibration tasks, both at heights and within equipment enclosures. · Maintain, test, and troubleshoot key systems, including: o Accelerator systems o Irradiation devices o Patient alignment systems o Safety interlock systems · Monitor the operation of the system and identify areas for performance improvement. · Adopt and integrate new technology, products, and processes to enhance system functionality. · Respond promptly to service calls, ensuring timely resolution and customer satisfaction. · Fulfill work orders, submit reports (including timecards, working reports, and expense reports), and adhere to company and customer procedures. · Assist with troubleshooting and commissioning activities when necessary. · Ensure compliance with regulatory standards, including radiation safety regulations, company policies, and applicable laws. · Work with high-voltage equipment, magnetic fields, and in radiation-prone environments. · Rotating shift work is required. (First Shift: 05:00 – 14:00 / Second Shift: 13:00 – 22:00)  Requirements: · Diploma or higher in engineering or related disciplines. · Experience in maintenance or field service. · Proficient in reading and interpreting engineering documents (e.g., schematics, circuit diagrams, piping diagrams). · Experience using electronic test and measurement instruments such as DVM, oscilloscopes, and micrometers. · Capable of working independently as well as collaboratively within cross-functional teams. · Excellent communication, problem-solving skills, and attention to detail. · Ability to understand and troubleshoot complex equipment and systems. · Familiarity with Microsoft Word and Excel. · Comfortable with working at heights and lifting up to 20 kg repeatedly. · A customer-focused mindset with a strong sense of teamwork.

Job Title: x50 Hourly Paid Charity Fundraisers Required! Work at your convenience!
Job Description: Working Time: 9am - 3pm - morning shift (Collection at West Side, Taman Jurong) 3pm-9pm - afternoon shift (Collection at East Side, Kaki Bukit) $11/hour Working Location: Street corners, shopping malls, door to door Attire: Blue Polo Provided/ Covererd Shoes / Long Pants / No Visible Tatoo  Description We are seeking compassionate and motivated temporary workers to assist in collecting donations for the less fortunate. The Temporary Donation Collector will play a key role in engaging the community, collecting donations, and supporting the success of this charitable cause. This position requires excellent communication skills, a positive attitude, and a strong commitment to helping those in need.  Donation Collection:Collect monetary donations via cash/ pay now from the public at designated locations (e.g., street corners, shopping malls, door to door). Provide information to donors about the cause and how their contributions will directly benefit the less fortunate. Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to engage and motivate people to donate. Friendly, approachable, and empathetic attitude. Ability to stand for long periods of time and work in various weather conditions (if outdoor collection). Basic record-keeping skills for documenting donations. Ability to work both independently and as part of a team. Obtain relevant underwriting information from clients for submission to underwriters for quotation and terms. 3. Prepare documentation required for insurance placement including quotation slips, placement/closing slips,     schedules and calculations, cover notes, endorsements and ensure that the required level of insurance      capacity is obtained. 4. Candidate is required/expected to complete a Certificate in General Insurance from the Singapore College of     Insurance within 3 to 6 months of joining the team.

Job Title: Head of University and Career Counselling
Company Name: GERMAN EUROPEAN SCHOOL SINGAPORE (DEUTSCHE EUROPAEISCHE SCHULE SINGAPUR)
Job Description: Head of University and Career Counselling Start Date: as soon as possible.  The German European School Singapore (GESS) is looking for experienced Head of University and Career Counselling.  The Head of University and Career Counselling is a senior position which works closely with the Senior Management Teams of the High School’s at GESS. Working collaboratively with relevant teams in the school, the job holder is responsible for providing strategic thinking in formulating, developing and executing strategies and programs as part of the overall strategic direction of German European School Singapore.  Responsibilities:  Lead the creation of a multi-year strategy to establish a center of excellence within the UCC department, collaborating with section Directors. Develop and manage university admissions and career counselling programs for European and German students (Grades 8-12), including guidance on university selection, standardized testing, application procedures, and scholarships. Conduct workshops and seminars for students and parents on admissions and career planning. Create and implement policies for ongoing support post-results day and develop career exploration programs. Integrate college and career planning into the curriculum, stay updated on international universities and career trends, and organize related events. Maintain detailed records, generate reports on student progress, and stay informed about changes in admissions criteria and industry requirements. Develop and manage a centralized Career and University Counselling Microsite, oversee the UCC budget, and enhance the University Counselling team on campus.  Requirements:  Relevant qualification/certification in university & careers counselling or 3-5 years of experience in a secondary school or student environment. Knowledge of university admissions processes in the US, UK, Europe (non-UK), and Australia. Experience with international students and culturally responsive practices. Strong communication, presentation, and technology skills. Ability to work strategically with senior leadership and manage a diverse team. Experience with German university admissions processes and German language skills are advantageous to liaise with German speaking students, colleagues and parents. Flexible approach, willingness to work beyond school hours, and meet deadlines.  Keen to collaborate and share your specialist expertise, you will be a fitting ambassador for the school. You will communicate with confidence across diverse audiences and situations, using your expertise to build strong relationships across the GESS community.  Our School The German European School Singapore (GESS) is a multi-lingual, not-for-profit, German international school in Singapore with a distinct European flavour. As an accredited ‘Excellent German School Abroad’, the German Section of GESS offers all major German school leaving certificates.  Our European Section offers tuition in English for students from grade 1 - 12 across all three IB programmes (the PYP, the MYP and the IB Diploma Programme) as an authorised IB World School.  Children aged 2 years onwards can enroll in our Preschool where children are following the PYP programme in German-speaking, English-speaking or bilingual groups. In addition to an outstanding academic education, GESS strives to teach students community values such as respect, openness and diversity.  To Apply We offer an exciting working environment in an international and cooperative team. Your application should include a letter of application and your complete resume. Please indicate your reasons for applying for the position.  Our Selection Process At GESS we adhere to fair employment practices that consist of hiring practices that are fair, merit-based and non-discriminatory.  We are committed to providing a world class, safe, happy environment in which children and young people are able to thrive and learn. We are committed to safeguarding and child protection as we promote the welfare of all our pupils irrespective of race, ability, religion, gender or culture.  All post holders are subject to appropriate vetting procedures including satisfactory reference and background checks and the offer of employment will be subject to the completion of these.  Please note, that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Development and Partnerships: Senior Manager Manage and implement donor development and fundraising efforts for ACF, with a focus on the private banking sector: unlocking greater philanthropic giving, connection of donors with nonprofit organisations, and scaling support for meaningful social impact work in Asia.  Asia Community Foundation (ACF) is an independent, trusted giving platform that catalyzes funding at scale with informed, efficient grant-making for donors acting individually or collectively. Singapore-based, this charitable organisation supports individuals, families, and institutions as their trusted partner in purposeful philanthropy. Established in 2022 by a group of philanthropists from Asia Philanthropy Circle, ACF was born out of the pressing need for a regional platform to facilitate cross-border giving in Asia. Our mission is to promote purposeful giving in Asia by connecting donors and nonprofits to achieve greater results than they could on their own. As a community, we believe that we can create positive change and address some of the most pressing socioeconomic and environmental issues facing Asia today.  Key Responsibilities: ACF is looking for a candidate with excellent communications and interpersonal skills who is passionate about contributing to the social impact sector, with a focus on engaging private banks, their teams and their clients. This will involve engaging with Mandarin speaking prospects so fluent Mandarin will be a prerequisite. Reporting to the Development Director, the Senior Manager for Development and Partnerships will focus on deepening partnerships and driving engagement efforts as ACF continues to grow and evolve. This includes cultivating partnerships with private banks and other similar intermediaries. Nurturing pipelines, cultivating relationships with individuals, RMs and wealth planners and working in collaboration with colleagues to guide new donors through their giving process at ACF. As a lean, fast-paced start-up organisation, team members should expect to multitask in a flexible environment in order to thrive.  Contribute to ACF’s annual donor development and fundraising plans and collaborate on execution efforts. Identify potential partners and manage communications with the financial institutions, consultancies and other industry intermediaries. Foster ongoing relationships with donors by working in consultative manner to understand needs and interests to support with strategic connection to organisations and ACF solutions as appropriate. Build pipelines for new donors through participation in events, workshops, and leveraging partnerships with banks, intermediaries, other organisations. Communicate ACF’s unique role and value in the philanthropy and social impact ecosystems. Contribute to managing and maintaining system for tracking proposals and progress status for new prospects and ongoing donor relationships. Contribute to planning and organisation of special events to support prospect development, partner education and relationship building. Create and maintain positive working relationships with colleagues, board members and APC team members.  Requirements:  5+ years’ work experience in the financial services sector: wealth management, private banking, or related client development and relationship management work. Demonstrated success in client development, fundraising or related work. Excellent English and Mandarin language communications—written, oral and listening; interpersonal, and relationship-building skills. Strong organisational skills and ability to self-start, make decisions and adjust to evolving situations. BA required, MA a plus.

We are on the lookout for talented 3D modelers to join our ever growing team. As a 3D modeller, you will be responsible for creating virtual worlds and characters. You will be breathing life into sketches and concept art. You will be working in a team with our talented artists, engineers and programmers. You must be well versed with industry-standard 3D modelling programs and tools. Good spatial skills and a well-honed sense of colour and design will help you succeed in this job. Responsibilities  Create and manage digital assets. Interpret concept art and sketches to create environments and props. Follow design guidelines, asset naming conventions and other technical constraints. Prototype and iterate on models and characters based on feedback from team members. Create textures and UV maps. Optimize, refine and correct model geometry. Work with artists and programmers to execute projects on time. Keep abreast with the latest developments in 3D design, capture and modelling tools and technologies.  Qualifications  Expert level knowledge of 3D design and modeling tools such as Blender, 3DS Max, Substance Painter, Sketchup, ZBrush etc. An eye for detail and good visualization skills. Ability to take feedback and make changes as required. Good communication skills. Minimum 2 years of experience in 3D design and modeling. Technical diploma in 3D modelling or a degree in fine arts. Some scripting experience (e.g. Python) will be an added bonus. Some experience in procedural modelling (e.g. Houdini) will be an added bonus.  Note: Above requirements describe the perfect candidate, please feel free to apply even though you may not meet all requirements. Please also include links to past works/portfolio for our review.
