Overview of Role A Commercial Analyst with Conrad Hotels and Resorts supports Commercial Senior Leadership team with best-practice guidance and to design and deliver regular as well as ad-hoc commercial analytics. Combine available internal data (sales, activities, systems, etc) along with external data sources to highlight opportunities for improvements in commercial execution.  What will it be like to work for this Hilton Brand? We are more than a place to stay; we are a place to Stay Inspired. Our job is to discover what inspires our Guests so that we may ensure an experience of a lifetime. Our job is also to discover what motivates and inspires each of us to consistently provide luxury service.  At Conrad, we take the time to understand the wants, needs and desires that make each of our Guests unique. Then we can create a stylish luxury experience that’s uniquely personal, deeply memorable and, above all, smart.  What will I be doing? As Commercial Analyst, you are responsible for working closely with the Commercial Senior Leadership team as well as collaborate with other departments. Demonstrate understanding of financial data and sales analytics, report on key trends to allow the department to anticipate necessary strategic or tactical adjustments.  Ability to utilize insights to drive sales and make connections between departments (Finance, F&B) to ensure business goals are met. Specifically, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards:  Review business plans, identify gaps using market intelligence and ensure proactive measures to fill to capacity and meet targets Support Revenue Management Consolidated Centre (RMCC) with implementation of new packages online ensuring that the necessary content is updated and visible across all online platforms Responsible for managing the Luxury Consortia platforms and implementation of promotions across need dates and maintaining relationship with Luxury Hilton Worldwide Sales (HWS) team Managing the Global Distribution Systems (GDS) advertising campaigns, ensuring the timeliness of the launch and updating the content on a quarterly basis Tracking and monitoring the performance of all online-related tactical promotions and coming up with recommendations for improvements Preparation of Sales Incentive Plan (SIP) – Tracking, submission & processing quarterly payout.  Recommend changes to the SIP where necessary Assist with forecasting and budgeting across all revenue streams - actively involved in meeting including catering pace, BFM, etc. Support the Delphi administrator to ensure Delphi standards are adhered to including Account Management, Bookings & Inquiries and maintaining quality standards Constantly looking for improvements in the efficiency and effectiveness of sales processes, subsequently implementing those changes with the support of the leadership team Dealing with questions from hotel ownership where required along with any additional ad-hoc tasks.   What are we looking for? A Commercial Analyst in Hilton is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members. To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviors, skills, and values that follow:  Positive attitude and good communication skills Commitment to delivering a high level of customer service Excellent grooming standards Strong leadership skills, whereas it is evident that you can effectively manage and motivate a team to perform beyond expectations Strong analytical skills so to understand key business indicators and competitive trends and develop approaches to these challenges Excellent organizational and planning skills Experience in a similar role with a proven track record It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions: Knowledge of local market Knowledge of hospitality Passion for sales and for achieving targets and objectives Degree-level qualification in a relevant field would be advantageous  What benefits will I receive? Your benefits will include holiday entitlement - as an employee you can become a member of ‘Go Hilton’ Programme which provides reduced hotel room rates in our hotels worldwide, plus discounts on products and services offered by Hilton Worldwide and its partners. We look forward to explaining in detail the range of excellent benefits that you would expect from a global hotel organization like Hilton.

About Us  Established in 1972, Guardian Health & Beauty is Singapore’s Number 1 Health and Beauty retailer. With more than 126 stores nation-wide, it retails a comprehensive range of health & beauty products. Guardian has evolved from its pharmacy roots to a holistic one-stop solution for customers’ health and beauty needs. It continues to expand its products and service range to meet the redefinition of beauty by today’s customers – where health meets beauty.  With a strong health heritage, it has the largest network of award-winning pharmacists and a wide selection of health products. Professional services such as patient-care counselling, dispensary services, beauty and personal care solutions are offered at stores as a convenient one-stop for health and beauty. Guardian also operates its online store with more than 9,000 products available and offers the “Click & Collect” services. For more information, please visit www.guardian.com.sg. Follow Guardian Health & Beauty on Facebook, Instagram, Telegram, Youtube and TikTok.  Guardian Health & Beauty is a Progressive Wage (PW) mark accredited company.  Role Purpose  To develop and implement strategic plans for assigned categories within the framework of a disciplined category management business process so as to achieve company’s financial goals and objectives, improve market share, customer satisfaction and productivity performance measures for the company  Responsibilities  Drive and achieve category sales, gross profit, income goals and objectives of assigned categories through monitoring trends within the market segments; developing strategies to grow the market share of assigned categories; and to plan strategies to counter competition. Develop and implement a good inventory management process so that there is an optimum product mix that focuses on customers’ needs and the process achieves shrinkage reduction objective. Develop and implement promotional plans that bring excitement and incremental sales to the stores. Develop and implement placement and planogram strategies that improve category turnover and positively influence customer shopping behavior. Oversees the implementation of category strategies as well as the development of the private label or house brand products. Ability to build strong relationships with business partners and is well-informed of consumer, market and industry trends Works in a dynamic environment were expected to regularly review market and industry trends to drive appeal of merchandise mix to target customers. Develop and implement a competitive pricing strategy that delivers value to our customers. Establish collaborative retailer / supplier relationships to maximize income/ terms / discounts to improve sales and profitability of category. To develop Weekly / Monthly Category Analysis Report of the assigned categories. Manage and evaluate promotion effectiveness to achieve maximum profitability for the categories  About You  Graduate with a diploma or university degree in business or marketing field. Possesses a minimum of 4 to 6 years of relevant experience, ideally within the retail or FMCG sector. Experience in a customer-focused industry, possessing expertise in merchandising, marketing, and entrepreneurial skills. Well-versed in industry trends and market dynamics, with excellent presentation, negotiation, and interpersonal abilities. Strong analytical skills to interpret data and generate valuable insights. Energetic, creative, and highly adaptable with a collaborative mindset. Fluent in English, with strong written and verbal communication skills. Organized, decisive, determined, and persistent individual.  Benefits  Team Member Discount Subsidized Medical and Dental Benefits Training Opportunities Career Advancement  Working Location: Tampines North

Job Description: About the role · The Operations Manager directs, plans, organizes and controls all activities of the manufacturing operations (production and production support) in order to meet short, medium and long term production goals. · The Operations Manager sets and monitor performance of the Plant against balanced scorecard set targets, following all the standards in areas such as people, safety, food safety, quality, manufacturing efficiency, and productivity. · They ensure and nurture a culture of “Safety, Food safety First and Quality always” mindset across their department, in line with the Barry Callebaut Go4Zero objective (0 accidents, 0 defects, 0 delays, 0 impact). She/he/they have the responsibility to act and speak up when deviations cannot be solved locally (example: supplier quality) · She/he/they ensures compliance with all relevant regulations on a country, local or global level, and constantly seek improvements through lean principles and people capabilities development towards achieving best in class performance.  Key responsibilities include Operations Manager focus is to ensure that production targets are met, and the facility operates efficiently, safely, and in compliance with all relevant regulations. He/she/they take responsibility to: · Ensure the safety of all employees, be familiar with and implement all relevant regulations related to safety, food safety, and environmental protection and always ensure compliance - Monitoring and improving safety, food safety and environmental performance. · Work with the QA department to implement, execute and maintain the quality management system. · Lead, direct, and control the day-to-day operational activities of the factory to achieve the quality, operational and financial objectives on short and medium-term in line with the overall master plan. · Hire and develop people: providing learning, growth, building culture and a strong cross functional collaborative approach. · Be a leadership role model living Barry Callebaut values and practicing servant leadership · Support the definition and execution of the budget; monitor the cost and effectiveness of production activities to optimize resources, prioritize spending, and achieve volume, quality, and manufacturing standards. · Identify and implement process improvements, lean manufacturing initiatives, and new technologies to increase efficiency and reduce waste. · Manage the infrastructure and assets of the operations areas and ensure the factory remains under hygienic conditions · Maintenance and equipment management: Overseeing the maintenance and repair of equipment and machinery to minimize downtime and ensure smooth production processes.  About you · Bachelor or Master Degree in Engineering or similar Technical field · Minimum local language fluency plus English (advanced) · Knowledgeable in MS Office Suite, SAP Systems and other applications used in manufacturing e.g. scheduling, CMMS, MES, etc · Strong technical background supporting continuous improvement work environment · Proven business and people management skills · Experience in Leading operational teams and Unions/Works Council context · Detailed knowledge of plant and manufacturing functional disciplines · Change Manager seeking Continuous improvement through lean principles and people capabilities development · Strong interpersonal and communication skills · Knowledge of latest quality and safety laws / regulations · Can prove strong focus on procedures (standardizing) · Good problem-solving abilities · Acts as a servant Leader · Excellent communication (written and verbal) skills both upward and downward · Works well under pressure, enabling his/her team to thrive under all circumstances · Strong attention to detail · Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities · Comfortable with managing positive change · Self-starter and results driven mind set and discipline to sustain results · Multitasking and time-management skills · Change Manager seeking continuous improvement through people capability development

With thousands of hotels in over 100 countries and territories, Hilton offers countless opportunities to delight. From an open door to a welcoming smile and an exceptional experience, we offer the millions of travellers who stay with us every year a welcome they will never forget. In addition to our flagship brand, Hilton Hotels & Resorts, the family of brands includes Waldorf Astoria, LXR, Conrad, Canopy, Curio Collection, DoubleTree, Hilton Garden Inn, Hampton and many others.  If you appreciate the impact global travel can have on the world, you may be just the person we are looking for to work as a Hilton Team Member. Because it’s with Hilton where we never forget the reason we're here: to delight our guests, Team Members, and owners alike.  A Director of Sales with Conrad Hotels and Resorts will contribute to Sales plan that maximizes revenue by driving the sale of conference facility space and guest rooms.  What will I be doing? The Director of Sales is responsible for developing a commercial strategy covering all managed room segments (IBT, IT, GT, CMTG, GOV), including residential and non-residential business to maximize the hotel’s total revenue. This role will drive the planning and execution of the commercial strategy and activity through support from the Revenue Management, Catering Sales, Events Management and Marketing. As Director of Sales, you will build a marketing plan and associated sales activities to execute with the Sales Team to achieve Sales targets and company goals. The Director of Sales will train, coach, and continuously develop the Sales Team. Specifically, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards:  Lead a team to identify and maximize all business opportunities that translate into revenue for the hotel, be it for Rooms, Food and Beverage including banquets, and other minor operating departments Coach and mentor the team to have the right spirit that would make us a formidable group of customer-focused and enterprising sales force that is second to none Handle business forecasting, budget planning and reviews, sales/marketing analysis, revenue management, pricing, positioning, promotions, advertising and overall marketing Identify critical areas for constant improvements in product, price and service levels, through sound and time sensitive market intelligence Act as a sounding board to the Management for new business opportunities and directly responsible for the hotel's main source of revenue Manage and develop relationships with key internal and external stakeholders.  Sales Activities  Conduct sales call activities to acquire new business and/or solicit business with existing customers. Activities can include sales calls, site inspection, tele-blitz, cold calls, entertainment, FAM trips, trade shows, etc Execute and support the operational aspects of business booked (e.g., generating proposal, writing contract, customer correspondence Expand new customer acquisitions and manage contacts with existing Guests and key contacts Conduct “Bring Back Old Business” and repeat calls to increase demand and overall revenue Cross sell other Hilton Worldwide properties wherever possible Build the marketing plan for the hotel to include sales targets based on market analysis All duties and processes to be carried out in line with Hilton brand standards/guidelines e.g. Centre of Excellence Account review to be conducted with the sales team on a quarterly basis to ensure that their performance is in-line with the targets and take any necessary corrective action where required  Using Knowledge of Market Trends and Target Customer Information to Maximize Revenue  Develop and maintain a broad range of product knowledge about the Hotel Understand the overall market - competitors' strengths and weaknesses, economic trends, supply and demand etc. and knows how to sell against them Communicate trends, opportunities and market changes to CD and appropriate parties, as needed Identify new business to achieve individual and team revenue goals and targets Gain understanding of our target customers and service expectations; serve the customer by understanding their business, business issues and concerns, to offer better business solution Willing to commit to firm and unambiguous decisions. Sets up contingencies in case decisions are unsuccessful  Providing Exceptional Customer Service  Support the company's service and relationship strategy, driving customer loyalty by delivering service excellence throughout each customer experience Service our customers in order to grow share of the account Execute and supports the company's customer service standards Provide excellent customer service consistent with the daily service basics of the company Set a positive example for guest relations Interact with guests to obtain feedback on product quality and service levels  Administration & Management  Handle business enquiry and daily correspondence in a timely and professional manner Create contracts as required Utilize intranet for resources and information Utilize Delphi to manage, document and track all managed account activities Submit daily/weekly/monthly reports to Commercial Director Complete and review monthly reports in a timely manner (owner’s report, MPR, catering occupancy, production report, etc Work closely with the Regional Director of Sales and Hilton Worldwide Sales team to drive business into the hotel Proficient in using hotel’s front office system management tool to manage and track business Proficient in using hotel’s Account Management Tool (Delphi/H360/HIS etc) to manage and track accounts Attend and be attentive in all daily briefings, department/team meetings and any other meeting as required Attend designated training programs Ensure that the team collects the first deposit where required and reviews all contractual terms prior to contracts being sent out Reviews proposals to ensure that all necessary information is captured prior to the team sending it out to clients and is correctly booked in Delphi. Monitor offers, options and discounts for repeat bookings for groups, congresses and seminars in close cooperation with the Group Coordinator Conduct performance reviews at least twice a year (Mid-Year and Year-End) for each team member Work closely with the Director of Catering to build a cohesive Business Development team Assist the Commercial Director in ensuring that targets and standards are met in the team   What are we looking for? A Director of Sales serving Hilton hotels and vacations are always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members. To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviors, skills, and values that follow:  The individual must possess the following knowledge, skills and abilities and be able to explain and demonstrate that he or she can perform the essential functions of the job, with or without reasonable accommodation. Knowledge of the hospitality industry, current market trends, and economic factors Excellent presentation and creative selling skills to uncover new business. Able to present information logically and confidently verbally and in written form Strong negotiation skills to close business with a maximum yield Proficient in using Microsoft office tools especially Excel to create documents, reports and presentation Ability to read, listen and communicate effectively in both written and spoken English, using correct grammar, spelling and sentence structure Ability to effectively deal with department heads, customers and team members, some of whom will require high levels of patience, tact and diplomacy Ability to manage time, resources, and personnel effectively and productively Ability to persuade, convince and influence others Persuasive and assertive in communication. Able to present arguments logically and face up to and resolve conflicts or criticism Maintains staff morale and motivation, pays attentions to the development of skills, pro activity and the taking of responsibility Prepared to fit working hours to business needs and to respond personally to work problems at short notice  Personality Characteristics  Self-motivated and able to work effectively without constant supervision A passion for sales and target-based performance An outstanding team player Innovative in the delivery of Sales initiatives Enthusiastic to be part of a winning team To have patience and take setbacks positively Stays calm, composed and effective under time pressure and when dealing with difficult or confrontational situations.  What will it be like to work for Hilton? Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travellers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!

Commitment Period: April to September 2025  Clarion Events Asia is looking for a professional and personable Delegate Sales Executive to be part of the leading regional event, Enlit Asia, which focuses on the power & energy sector. This is an excellent opportunity for an exceptional Business Events professional to join a highly successful, award winning, international company that organizes essential B2B events for a range of clients across the world. We work closely with leading industry executives to organise high level events.  About Enlit Asia Enlit Asia is an annual conference and exhibition that unifies two major events in the power and energy sector - POWERGEN Asia and Asian Utility Week. The event is a platform for leading industry providers to showcase innovative solutions, services, and products in line with the Asian strategy to transition to a low-carbon energy supply. Through its Summit, Enlit Asia also delivers expert knowledge and foresight from the region's power and energy thought leaders on key developments, policies and innovations that are driving the energy transition. It brings together the entire value chain of both power and utility producers and suppliers, covering content and exhibits from source to generation and from grid to consumer.  The Role As a Delegate Sales at Enlit Asia, you will play a crucial role in expanding our sales reach and driving new business opportunities. You will be the “front-face” for all conference delegates. You will sell delegate tickets as part of your key KPI. This role will require an understanding of content, basic industry knowledge of the power & energy value chain and direct selling skills to acquire paying attendees to our events. If you are personable, have a dynamic disposition, a keen learner and are confident speaking with senior executives over the phone, this is a role for you!  We are open to candidates working remotely.  Job specifications  To sell delegate tickets to attend the conference To be the main point of contact onsite for paid delegate attendees To co-ordinate and manage meetings for sponsors and exhibitors To secure high-level attendees for workshops, private luncheons, roundtables etc. To provide sponsors and attendees with a truly great experience pre and during the conference and to provide a fantastic service element to the networking process  Key Requirements  Diploma or degree qualified Great attitude to learning Previous delegate sales or customer experience a plus Excellent verbal and written communication skills Confident in speaking with C-level executives Not afraid of cold calling via phone and making new connections Strong relationship building, stakeholder management and social media skills to ensure customer satisfaction Performance driven, possessing exceptional interpersonal qualities and able to work alone (self-motivate) and in a team Dependable – takes responsibility for own actions, keeps commitments Able to work with tight deadlines, manage time and balance tasks  About Clarion Events Clarion Events organises more than 200 events (a mixture of exhibitions, conferences and seated events) annually across the globe. More than 12,000 companies trust us with their custom each year and over 700,000 people give their valuable time to visit our events.  This success has come from identifying high-value, niche audiences in difficult-to-reach markets and then building them into market-leading products. We have over 500 people working directly for Clarion Events from 13 offices in 10 different countries, including Brazil, Germany, The Netherlands, Singapore, China, South Africa, Turkey, UAE, UK, and USA.

Job Summary:The Geotechnical Engineer is responsible for investigating and analyzing the properties and behavior of soil and rock to ensure the stability and safety of structures such as buildings, bridges, roads, and dams. The role involves conducting field and laboratory tests, interpreting data, and providing recommendations for design and construction.  Key Responsibilities:  Site Investigation: Conduct field investigations including soil borings, test pits, and sampling. Evaluate site conditions and gather relevant data. Laboratory Testing: Oversee or perform laboratory testing on soil and rock samples to determine their physical and mechanical properties. Analysis and Design: Analyze geotechnical data to assess soil stability, bearing capacity, and other relevant parameters. Provide recommendations for foundation design, slope stability, and ground improvement techniques. Reporting: Prepare detailed geotechnical reports and design recommendations. Communicate findings clearly to clients, project managers, and other stakeholders. Consultation: Work closely with civil engineers, architects, and construction teams to integrate geotechnical considerations into project designs and construction plans. Compliance: Ensure that all geotechnical work complies with local, state, and federal regulations and standards. Problem Solving: Address and resolve geotechnical challenges that arise during the design and construction phases of projects.  Work Conditions:  Fieldwork may be required, including site visits and inspections, which may involve outdoor work in varying weather conditions. Office work includes data analysis, report preparation, and project planning.

Company Name: THE EDGE CONTRACTING SERVICES PTE. LTD.
Job Description: Project Manager - 12-months Contract - Singapore  What We Offer:  Competitive salary and benefits package. Opportunities for career advancement and growth. A dynamic, unique work environment with a collaborative culture. The chance to work on impactful projects that drive organizational change.   Job Summary: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Project Manager with a solid Information Technology (IT) technical background to lead, manage, and drive complex, large-scale, enterprise-level projects. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in project management, vendor management, and stakeholder communication, and be capable of successfully managing multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. You will be responsible for ensuring that projects are delivered on time, within scope, and on budget while maintaining strong relationships with key stakeholders, including senior and C-level executives.   Key Responsibilities:  Lead and manage end-to-end delivery of large-scale, complex IT projects, from planning and execution to completion, ensuring adherence to scope, schedule, and budget. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define project objectives, timelines, and deliverables, and ensure alignment with organizational goals. Manage and monitor project budgets, timelines, and resources, taking corrective action when necessary to avoid delays or cost overruns. Effectively manage relationships with external vendors, ensuring performance and service delivery are in line with contractual agreements. Build and foster strong working relationships with key internal and external stakeholders, including senior and C-level executives, to manage expectations, drive buy-in, and secure necessary project resources and support. Deliver clear, concise, and regular project status updates to stakeholders, highlighting risks, issues, and mitigation plans. Develop and implement project plans, including scope, schedule, and resource allocation, in alignment with business and technical requirements. Navigate and thrive in a fast-paced environment, adapting to changing priorities and resolving issues in real-time. Lead risk management and issue resolution efforts, proactively identifying potential problems and developing strategies to mitigate impact. Ensure compliance with internal processes, standards, and best practices for project management, IT governance, and quality assurance. Maintain a strong focus on continuous improvement, implementing lessons learned from previous projects to improve future outcomes.  Qualifications:  Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field (or equivalent experience). 5+ years of project management experience, with a focus on IT projects (enterprise-level, large-scale). Strong technical background with a solid understanding of IT systems, infrastructure, and software development processes. Proven ability to drive complex projects from initiation through to delivery, including managing multiple stakeholders, both internal and external. Experience with vendor management, ensuring alignment with project goals and timely, high-quality deliverables. Ability to effectively manage expectations and communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, especially senior and C-level executives. Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills, with the ability to identify risks and implement mitigation strategies. Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present to and engage senior leadership. Ability to thrive under pressure and handle multiple tasks and changing priorities in a fast-paced environment. PMP, Agile, or other relevant certifications preferred. Experience with project management tools (e.g., JIRA, MS Project, Trello, or similar) and methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall, Scrum).

We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Network Security Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience in managing and configuring Cisco wireless infrastructure, switches, and routers, as well as proficiency with Palo Alto and Checkpoint Firewalls.  Key Responsibilities:  Cisco Wireless Infrastructure Management:  Configure, deploy, and manage Cisco wireless access points and controllers to ensure reliable wireless network connectivity. Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to wireless network performance, coverage, and security. Managing the Cisco ISE.   Cisco Switches and Routers Management:   Install, configure, and maintain Cisco switches and routers for optimal network performance.  Perform network troubleshooting, identify bottlenecks, and implement solutions to ensure network reliability.   Firmware Upgrades:  Upgrade firmware for wireless devices, routers, and switches as part of regular network maintenance and improvement. Ensure minimal disruption during firmware updates and troubleshooting any issues that arise.   Network Monitoring with SolarWinds:  Utilize SolarWinds for continuous monitoring of the network infrastructure, including switches, routers, and wireless systems. Respond to alerts, troubleshoot network issues, and optimize network performance based on monitoring data.   Firewall Management (Palo Alto, Checkpoint):  Configure and maintain Palo Alto and Checkpoint firewalls to ensure network security and integrity. Monitor firewall performance, implement policy changes, and respond to any security incidents or alerts.   Required Skills and Qualifications: • Proven experience in managing and configuring Cisco wireless infrastructure, switches, and routers. • Strong knowledge and hands-on experience with SolarWinds network monitoring tool. • Proficiency in managing Palo Alto and Checkpoint firewalls. • Strong troubleshooting skills for network and security-related issues. • Ability to perform firmware upgrades for network devices and equipment. • Familiarity with network security practices and protocols. • CCNP (Cisco Certified Network Associate) certification or equivalent is a plus. • Experience with network documentation and creating network diagrams.  Preferred Skills: • Advanced Cisco certifications (CCNP) or equivalent. • Knowledge of other network security platforms. • Experience in implementing network automation or orchestration tools.  Personal Attributes: • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work under pressure. • Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work with cross-functional teams. • Self-motivated and able to manage multiple tasks and priorities.  Education and Experience: • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology. • Minimum of 8 years of experience in a similar role.

Highly adaptable to changes  Key Stakeholders External: Sales force within the BDMs of other insurers Internal: Other departments within Singlife and Singlife FAPropel  If you find yourself able to demonstrate the criteria above, apply with us now. We look forward to your application.

Job Title: Senior Research Fellow (Healthcare Redesign)(6127) - Alexandra Hospital
Company Name: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
Job Description: Overview* Alexandra Hospital, a member of the National University Health System (NUHS) cluster, is a historic site providing integrated, holistic care to patients. The hospital is a test bed for innovative care approaches in Singapore and is currently running a diverse portfolio of studies. Alexandra Research Centre for Healthcare In a Virtual Environment (ARCHIVE) is set-up to support the design of innovative experiments in hospital-supported, community-focused, patient-centred virtual care (vCare) models. ARCHIVE’s projects can include research studies, quality improvement projects and clinical trials that incorporate digital technology to ensure the care models are future ready. The successful candidate will be expected to contribute towards new virtual healthcare projects and manage tasks on the evaluation of existing vCare programs in the areas of telemonitoring, telecollaboration, connected ward ecosystem and virtual care centre. Job Responsibilities* You will be responsible for the following:  Successfully manage projects from start-up to completion. Study protocol development Develop statistical analysis plans and conduct analyses. Oversee study compliance to the ethics requirements and local regulations Supervision of quantitative and/or qualitative analysis Development of scientific papers and the dissemination of the study findings Preparation of proposals for new grants Conduct literature reviews, including systematic reviews. Mentoring junior staff Engage with healthcare professionals and collaborators to support research activities.  Requirements*  PH.D. in Public Health or Health Services Research Proven track record in clinical/public health/health services research, with outstanding management abilities and a demonstrated track record of leadership. Minimum 2 years’ relevant experiences Strong acumen with in-depth understanding of quantitative and ideally qualitative research methodologies. Proficient in use of standard statistical or qualitative software e.g. STATA, SPSS, NVivo. Good scientific writing skills as demonstrated by track records of publications in international peer-reviewed journals Able to drive research projects from design, implementation to deployment Project management capabilities and experience in driving a cohesive research team and cross teaming environment Possess confidence to resonate with clinician investigators and research collaborators – internal and external stakeholders Ability to multi-task and work under tight timelines Good analytical and organization skills Excellent communication, problem solving, presentation, negotiation and interpersonal skill  If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Please indicate the position that you are interested in the subject heading. *Only Singapore Citizens and Singapore Permanent Residents may apply.

Company Name: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
Job Description: Overview To support investigators in conducting clinical research according to study protocol, Singapore Guideline for Good Clinical Practice (SGGCP) and other applicable regulatory and ethical requirements and hospital policies. Job Responsibilities Research projects administration - Process and manage qualitative and quantitative study data, including the followings:  Plan, organise and co-ordinate study activities workflow, including participant recruitment and coordination of study teams via regular meetings Help PIs devise a data management plan for both qualitative and quantitative studies Be able to help with data collection with patients, including the administration of survey and the conduction of qualitative interviews Handle data entry (including transcription for qualitative studies) and validation of study data, e.g., ensure that data is correctly recorded. Maintain records and manage e-filing system for documents related to specific research projects. Process collected data for analysis purposes, including the maintenance and handling of data employing Excel and basic functions of SPSS Help conduct literature searches; perform article srcreening for systematic reviews. Liaise with stakeholders from other areas (e.g., finance) and coordinate related logistics. Ensure timeliness in making payments to patients/volunteers. Track utilisation of budget. Document and tabulate financial payments received and / or made to support the study; assist with procurement; Maintain Investigator Site File and ensure that all study documents are complete and up to date. During meetings, collate agendas, prepare materials, record minutes and track progress of follow up items. Prepare regular reports to HOD and research unit on progress of projects;  track achievements and contribute towards preparing regular progress reports to NMRC.  Patient/Research Subject/Healthy Volunteers Management  Assist investigators in the screening and recruitment of potential research subjects/patients/healthy volunteers as according to trial protocol. Communicate to patients and volunteers on project demands and obtain informed consent. Maintain and update screening log & enrollment logs. Schedule appointments for patients/subjects. Ensure patients’/subject’s compliance to trial medication (if any). Perform venepuncture and cannulation as required according to trial protocol if any. Ensure compliance to safety procedures when performing such procedures.  Ensure projects’ compliance  Maintain database of patients’/subjects’ data and ensure compliance with confidentiality and PDPA requirements. Ensure compliance with the SGGCP and other applicable regulatory and ethical requirements and restructured / polyclinics’ policies if applicable. Assist investigators in applying for ethics review and to the Health Sciences Authority (HSA) for clinical trial certificates (if required)  Job Requirements  Bachelor’s degree in health sciences or nursing Preferably with 2 to 4 years of relevant experience in recruiting patients for research projects in a healthcare institution. Possess strong interpersonal skills. Preferably have some experience in conducting focus-group interviews Excellent team player with ability to work independently and proactively. Meticulous with an eye for detail. Resourceful with a creative ability to make things happen. Proficient with Outlook, Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel

Facilitate negotiation, conflict resolution, and grievance meetings with stakeholders to achieve mutually agreed outcomes. We are seeking an experienced and dynamic ESG Assistant Manager / Senior to join our Sustainability and ESG team at Baker Tilly. This role involves delivering comprehensive ESG solutions to clients, including ESG due diligence, sustainability reporting, sustainable finance advisory, and compliance with global ESG frameworks. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to support clients in navigating the complexities of ESG integration and aligning their strategies with emerging sustainability requirements.  Key Responsibilities  1. ESG Advisory & Compliance  Assist clients in developing and implementing ESG strategies aligned with their business goals and stakeholder expectations. Provide guidance on ESG regulatory compliance and reporting standards, including TCFD, ISSB, GRI, SASB, and jurisdiction-specific regulations. Conduct ESG materiality assessments, gap analyses, and stakeholder engagement exercises.   2. ESG Due Diligence  Lead ESG due diligence assessments for mergers, acquisitions, and investment opportunities. Evaluate ESG risks and opportunities in transactions and provide actionable recommendations to mitigate risks and enhance value creation. Develop ESG integration frameworks for private equity, venture capital, and corporate clients.   3. Climate Reporting & Modelling  Oversee the development of climate-related disclosures in line with TCFD / ISSB S2 recommendations and other climate frameworks. Conduct scenario analysis and climate modeling to evaluate potential risks and impacts of climate change on client operations and financial performance. Analyse climate data to support clients in understanding and mitigating transitional and physical climate risks. Develop emissions reduction pathways and net-zero roadmaps using advanced climate modeling techniques.   4. Sustainability Reporting  Oversee the preparation and review of ESG and sustainability reports to ensure compliance with global standards. Analyse ESG data and metrics to support transparent, accurate, and impactful reporting. Advise clients on ESG data collection, management, and technology-enabled reporting processes.   5. Sustainable Finance Advisory  Support clients in aligning financial strategies with ESG principles, including green bonds, sustainability-linked loans, and other sustainable finance instruments. Conduct assessments and certifications for green and sustainable financing initiatives. Provide insights on global sustainable finance trends and help clients access ESG-linked funding opportunities.   6. ESG Ratings & Benchmarking  Guide clients in improving their ESG ratings (e.g., MSCI, S&P, CDP) and benchmarking against industry peers. Provide strategies to address ESG-related performance gaps and enhance market positioning.   7. Client Management & Business Development  Build strong client relationships, acting as a trusted advisor for their ESG and sustainability needs. Support business development efforts, including crafting proposals, delivering presentations, and participating in client pitches. Identify opportunities for expanding the firm’s ESG service offerings and assist in go-to-market strategies.   8. Team Development & Collaboration  Mentor and coach junior team members, fostering professional growth and knowledge-sharing. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including transaction advisory, tax, audit, and corporate finance, to deliver holistic ESG solutions. Stay abreast of industry developments, emerging ESG trends, and regulatory changes to inform client engagements.   Qualifications and Skills  Bachelor’s degree in Sustainability, Environmental Science, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field Master’s degree or certifications (e.g., SASB FSA, GRI, CFA ESG, or PRI Academy) are highly desirable 4+ years of experience in ESG consulting, sustainable finance, or ESG due diligence, preferably in a professional services or consulting firm In-depth knowledge of ESG frameworks, reporting standards, and sustainable finance principles Proven expertise in ESG risk assessment, due diligence processes, and financial impact evaluation Strong analytical skills with proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools (e.g., Excel) Excellent project management skills, with the ability to handle multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment Exceptional communication and stakeholder engagement skills, with client-facing experience Strong knowledge of global sustainable finance instruments and frameworks

Job Title: Senior Operations Manager (Events) - Jan / Feb to Dec 2025
Job Description: Contract Position: January/February to December 2025  About Clarion Events We are the world largest privately owned event and exhibition organiser, known for our innovative approach, market-leading events and digital products. Founded in 1947, we have expanded to become a truly international organisation with offices in 12 countries. With a portfolio of 125 events and media brands across various vertical markets, we employ around 2,000 people worldwide.  At Clarion we aim to foster growth for both our clients and partners by delivering exceptional events and platforms while retaining talented employees and nurturing loyal partnerships. we focus on creating long-term value and sustaining leadership in all our sectors.  Key Responsibilities  Support events project team including conferences, exhibitions, virtual events and other ad hoc meetings. Running virtual events and webinars, platform set up, speaker liaison, and live stream coordination including chasing speakers recording & webinar materials, designer and editor, prepping speaker onboarding, conduct tech checks and rehearsals, webinar show calling etc. Ability to liaise with senior industry stakeholders with effective communication  and language. Manage exhibitor and sponsor logistics to ensure all sponsor and exhibitor  packages are fulfilled as sold by the portfolios, including event floorplan. Production and timely communication of correct and detailed technical manuals for exhibitors. Manage all speaker requirements (C-Suite / Senior Management level) to ensure  that the conference programmes run smoothly. Arrange travel and accommodation for staff and speakers within a pre-set budget. Respond quickly and calmly to requests from speakers, sponsors, overseas partners and exhibitors pre-event and onsite. Manage suppliers and orders for all event signage, AV, venue, catering,  printings, sponsored items etc. Manage the costs, prepare and report event budgets including raising purchase  orders, obtaining final costs and signing off invoices with approval. Develop a thorough understanding of health & safety principles and ensuring all parties are in compliance. Assist the Operations team with any other ad hoc tasks as required. Includes ad-hoc administration tasks as required by Head of Operations. Work as part of a team delivering the operations for medium/ large conferences  and Exhibitions. Available to travel in APAC. Report to Operations Director, and work closely with the Portfolio Directors, Producers, the project team and other Operations team members to seamlessly deliver the event.  Knowledge, Skills, Attitude and Behaviour:  Demonstrate clear and effective communication of ideas and processes As the successfully candidate will need to liaise with speakers and exhibitors from China, knowledge (written and spoken) of Mandarin is essential. Experience in the MICE industry and virtual events is desirable Organised and methodical Strong social and communication skills Able to deal with a broad range of people Self-motivated and able to take responsibility Keen to embrace and learn to use new technology and IT systems Able to work within a team Adaptable Problem solver Good attention to detail Able to manage time effectively Work calmly under pressure Prepared  to work additional hours and weekends in the lead up to events (when necessary)

Client Our client, a leading bank among the top three in Singapore, is looking for research ops to join the Group Transformation team. Blending art and science, employing design thinking and experimentation to build innovative solution that revolutionize how people live, work, and play. The Team is passionate about creating a joyful banking experience and having fun while they do it!  Job Type: 1-year contract/ subject to extension based on performance  Work Location: Central   The Role: As a Research Ops Specialists within the Customer Experience Strategy team. You’ll have a unique opportunity to share the future of the Bank. This is a high-impact where you’ll not only manage the operational aspects of research but also leverage AI to unlock deeper insights.  Your Impact:  Elevate Research Operations: Manage our internal customer panel, including recruitment of customers for conducting research and agreements. Curate andmanage our centralized research insights repository. Track and maintain comprehensive project data across the organization. Drive Innovation with AI: Apply AI to large datasets, preparing data and comparing AI-generated insights with existing research. This is a chance to be at the forefront of leveraging AI for impactful customer experience improvements. Empower the Bank: Support to deliver engaging qualitative research training programs to Bank staff, ensuring standardized processes and high-quality learning experiences. Continuously improve training materials to align with organizational goals. Strategic Support: Contribute to the successful launch of new research initiatives across the region, managing projects effectively and collaborating with cross-functional teams.  Skills & Experience:  Degree in Social Sciences in Sociology, anthropology, Business/Marketing/UX research. Proven project management skills with a track record of meeting deadlines and managing multiple stakeholders. Comfort and experience applying AI/algorithms to data analysis and able to write prompts is a bonus. Exceptional written and verbal communication and presentation skills. Proactive, innovative mindset with a passion for problem-solving. Meticulous attention to detail; a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment. Senior Project (Civil) Engineer Civil engineering projects - Roadworks, Cycling Infrastructure, Tunnel works   Responsible for advanced Planning, designing, integrating, scheduling, budgeting of construction project including management of contractors and vendors Act on behalf Project Manager to play leadership role within project team, overseeing planning, execution, and completion of engineering projects. Responsible for supervising and assessing the set-up of all project components, manage all aspects of an engineering project, prepare schedules, communicate with clients, project progress. Resources (Manpower, Material & Machineries) planning, Relationship with clients and manage of contractors, subcontractors, and vendors   Job Responsibilities : Project Management: You will be responsible for managing the entire project lifecycle, from initial planning to project completion. This includes defining project objectives, developing project plans, allocating resources, and ensuring that the project is delivered on time and within budget, actively involve in site and progress coordination, Method statement, submission and approval, monitor licenses, permits and compliances.  Technical Expertise: As a senior project engineer, you are expected to possess a strong technical background in your field of expertise. You will apply your knowledge and experience to solve complex engineering problems, provide technical guidance to the project team, and make critical decisions regarding design, implementation, and testing.  Stakeholder Communication: As a senior project engineer, you will act as the primary point of contact for project stakeholders, including clients, contractors, vendors, and internal departments. You will communicate project updates, address concerns, manage expectations, and ensure effective collaboration between all parties involved.  Risk Management: You will identify potential risks and develop strategies to mitigate them. This includes conducting risk assessments, implementing risk mitigation plans, and monitoring risks throughout the project. Additionally, you will ensure compliance with safety regulations and quality standards.  Budget and Cost Control: You will be responsible for managing the project budget and controlling costs. This involves estimating project costs, tracking expenses, monitoring financial performance, and adjusting as necessary to ensure the project remains within the allocated budget.  Documentation and Reporting: You will maintain accurate and detailed project documentation, including technical specifications, engineering drawings, progress reports, and other relevant records. You will also prepare regular status reports and presentations for project stakeholders, providing updates on project milestones, risks, and overall performance.  Continuous Improvement: As a senior project engineer, you will actively seek opportunities for process improvement and optimization. You will analyse project outcomes, identify lessons learned, and implement best practices to enhance project efficiency, quality, and outcomes.  Job Requirements:  Degree in Civil Engineering or related qualifications preferably recognized by the PE Board Minimum 7 years of relevant experiences in the construction industry Meticulous, independent and able to work within tight deadlines Excellent interpersonal and communication skills Good analytical and problem solving skills

Job Title: Senior Simulation Engineer - Electrochemical Modeling Location: NTU-Durapower Advanced Lithium Battery Joint Lab, #02-01, 1 Cleantech Loop, Singapore 637141  Overview:  We are seeking a passionate and experienced Senior Simulation Engineer specializing in electrochemical modeling to join our innovative Battery Material Research Division. This role is crucial in advancing simulation technologies to evaluate and optimize battery performance, safety, and longevity. It emphasizes a hands-on approach to laboratory experiments and leveraging simulation tools to develop cutting-edge lithium-ion and solid-state battery technologies.  Job Scope: Senior Simulation Engineer - Electrochemical Modeling Key Responsibilities:  Conduct research into battery working principles and failure mechanisms, developing multiscale and multiphysics-based battery models for rapid performance evaluation and diagnosis. Establish and refine electrochemical models, perform parameter determination, and execute numerical calculations and result analyses. Explore and implement simulation technologies to assess battery electrical performance, thermal runaway safety, and life prediction, providing actionable insights for the team. Utilize simulation outcomes to optimize existing product designs and propose innovative product design strategies. Design and execute experiments to generate data for training, validating, and testing battery models.  Key Requirements:  Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD in Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry, Materials Science, or relevant Engineering disciplines. Strong foundation in lithium-ion cell electrochemistry and mechanisms. Hands-on expertise with battery testing equipment, protocols, and physical-chemical evaluation techniques. Proficiency in electrochemical simulation and algorithm development software, such as COMSOL, MATLAB/Simulink, or equivalent tools. Practical experience in experimental battery research, including DOE design and analysis. Capability in electrochemical testing and analysis of battery materials. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. Collaborative and detail-oriented mindset, with effective communication skills for cross-functional teamwork.

Job Responsibilities Primary Responsibilities (80%): • Check the suction and diathermy machines for cleanliness and good working order • Check operating lights for clarity and good functioning • Clean, check and prepare operating table and accessories • Prepare the operating room for each patient scheduled on the operating list • Assist in the safe transfer of patient from trolley to operating table and vice versa • Assist in positioning the patient • Assist surgeon in application of tourniquet • Adjust and focus the operating lights and assist nurses in patient care • Perform daily inventory check on positioning aids and accessories • Perform cleaning of the operating room in between cases within 15mins • Clear soiled linen and surgical wastes to the disposal room after the next case had started or when necessary time allows • Ensure that the disposable suction liner is capped tightly before discarding into the biohazard bag • Maintain proper housekeeping of OT suite which include operating room, prep-room, scrub room, Anaes room and sluice room daily • Do terminal cleaning at the end of the list or after infected cases as stated in the protocol • To stay in the operating room to assist the surgical team when needed, eg. Change the suction liner, additional adhoc equipment needed etc Secondary Responsibilities (20%): • Maintain proper housekeeping of pantry • Transport patient from the ward to OT and vice versa • Perform routine cleaning of OT equipment e.g. tourniquet, light source etc weekly • Perform any other duties as assigned  Requirements • WSQ Higher Certificate in Healthcare Support (Operating Theatre Support) or relevant working experience as an Operating Theatre Technician • Possess initiative and keen to learn • Possess good interpersonal and communication skills  If the role sounds interesting to you, please contact ‘careers_alexandra@nuhs.edu.sg’ to understand more on the role. Company Name: THE EDGE CONTRACTING SERVICES PTE. LTD.
Job Description: Software Tester (Automation) - 2 Years Contract - Singapore We are seeking a Quality Assurance Engineer with at least 3 years of experience in Cucumber, TestNG and Playwright. The ideal candidate will play a pivotal role in ensuring the delivery of high-quality software by designing, implementing, and maintaining robust testing frameworks. This role involves both manual and automated testing across various stages of the software development lifecycle. Key Responsibilities:  Develop, maintain, and enhance automated test cases, test plans, and testing frameworks to align with evolving requirements and policies. Build, improve, and manage test environments and frameworks for automated testing. Conduct comprehensive testing of new features, including functional, manual, performance, and exploratory testing. Identify and document defects, ensuring effective resolution. Support User Acceptance Testing (UAT) processes. Collaborate in troubleshooting and resolving production issues.  Qualifications and Requirements:  At least 3 years in software quality testing with hands-on experience in automation. In-depth knowledge of testing techniques, risk analysis, and methodologies. Strong understanding of test-driven development (TDD), continuous integration (CI), and continuous delivery (CD). Proficiency in programming languages such as Java or Kotlin; familiarity with Spring Boot is a plus. Hands-on experience with open-source testing frameworks like Cucumber, TestNG, or Playwright. Familiarity with performance testing tools such as JMeter, Gatling, or enterprise tools like HP LoadRunner. Exposure to penetration testing tools such as ZAP, Burp Suite, SQL Map, or enterprise solutions like CheckMarx or Nessus.  This is a 2 years contract to start, renewable and convertible to permanent.

Categorie: Building and Construction, Engineering, Precision Engineering
Job Description: RESIDENT ENGINEER - RE (Road works - LTA project), Realignment & Diversion  Overseeing construction projects, ensuring compliance with specifications, codes, and safety standards. Focus on supervising the technical aspects of the project, ensuring timely execution, and resolving any issues that may arise during construction  Responsibilities:  Project Supervision and Oversight: Act as the key on-site representative, ensuring that all civil and structural works are carried out in compliance with contract specifications, design drawings, and regulatory requirements. Oversee construction activities to ensure project schedules are adhered to, and work quality is maintained.  Coordination with Stakeholders: Liaise with the project management team, contractors, sub-contractors, and consultants to resolve issues related to design, construction methodology, or site conditions. Ensure clear communication between all parties to facilitate smooth project execution.  Quality Assurance & Control: Inspect and monitor construction activities to ensure adherence to design standards and quality benchmarks. Conduct quality control checks and verify that materials used meet project specifications.  Regulatory and Code Compliance: Ensure that all civil and structural works comply with local building regulations, safety standards, and codes. Prepare and submit necessary documentation to regulatory authorities, and ensure compliance with inspection and approval processes.  Technical Issue Resolution: Identify and resolve technical issues related to design, materials, and construction methodologies. Propose solutions to problems that may arise during construction without compromising on safety, quality, or project timelines.  Site Safety: Ensure adherence to all site safety protocols and statutory safety regulations. Conduct site safety inspections and enforce corrective actions when needed.  Documentation and Reporting: Maintain detailed records of all construction activities, site conditions, test results, and progress reports. Provide regular reports on project progress, quality control issues, and any non-conformance issues.   Key Activities:  Daily Site Supervision: Inspect the site daily to monitor progress, assess workmanship, and check material deliveries. Identify any potential delays or risks and take preemptive measures to mitigate these.  Review of Drawings and Specifications: Review construction drawings, specifications, and method statements to ensure they are up-to-date and reflect actual site conditions. Ensure any design changes are communicated clearly and implemented correctly on-site.  Coordination of Structural Tests and Inspections: Arrange for and oversee structural tests (e.g., soil tests, pile load tests) to confirm that materials and construction techniques meet required standards. Coordinate with independent inspectors for statutory inspections.  Contractor and Subcontractor Management: Oversee contractors and subcontractors to ensure their work aligns with project goals, standards, and timelines. Approve or reject works based on their quality and adherence to plans.  Problem-Solving and Issue Resolution: Proactively identify and resolve potential issues related to construction sequencing, materials, or structural integrity. Work with design engineers to adjust plans if necessary based on on-site conditions.  Regular Site Meetings: Attend regular site meetings to discuss project progress, resolve any issues, and ensure alignment with project timelines.  Final Inspections and Handover: Participate in the final inspections to ensure that the project meets all contractual and regulatory requirements before the handover to the client. Ensure all necessary certifications, as-built drawings, and warranties are in place for the final project handover.    Requirements: Qualified & Recognized RE cert awarded by The Institution of Engineers, Singapore Minimum three (3) years of relevant experience as a Resident Engineer with related project experiences. Preferably road diversion, Infrastructure work, Linked bridge, and cycling pathway experiences

Company Name: ASSOCIATION EDHEC BUSINESS SCHOOL SINGAPORE BRANCH
Job Description: About EDHECinfra EDHECinfra is a provider of market indices, benchmarks and valuation analytics for investors in unlisted infrastructure equity and private debt. EDHECinfra maintains the infraMetrics® platform: an online information system that gives access to key market indices including the infra300® and infra100® series. InfraMetrics® also includes a wealth of valuation data and analytics, risk metrics, a fund strategy analysis tool providing robust performance quartiles for any segment, strategy or vintage, and peer group analyses allowing investors to compare themselves against comparable segments of the market. Role Great opportunity to join a growing and global team that is bringing new and high-quality data and rating services to investors, focusing on the estimation of climate risks’ financial materiality. Climate physical and transition risks will be taking an increasing part of investors’ portfolios and corporates’ balance sheets in the near future, creating a need for assessing and pricing them. We are looking for a full-stack developer skilled in React.js, JavaScript, and TypeScript for front-end development, as well as Python for back-end development. The role involves taking over a climate rating website, improving its existing features, and developing new functionality and contributing to its aesthetic and user experience (UX). You will be responsible for ensuring that the platform remains efficient, secure, and aligned with modern standards. Collaboration with teams to gather requirements and troubleshoot issues is essential. Responsibilities · Develop and maintain front-end components using TypeScript, JavaScript, and React.js. · Develop APIs for CRUD operations on a MongoDB database, using Python with FastAPI. · Write clean, efficient, and testable code using automated testing frameworks such as Jest and Cypress. · Work closely with DevOps for application deployment and maintenance on AWS cloud infrastructure. · Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and implement new features. · Troubleshoot and resolve production issues across the full stack to ensure optimal performance and reliability. Requirements · 5+ years of professional coding experience. · Degree in Computer Science or Engineering preferred. · Comprehensive understanding of React.js and its core principles. · Proficiency in JavaScript (preferably TypeScript). · Experience with Python and FastAPI. · Experience with Wordpress would be advantageous. · Ability to create basic mockups using tools such as Figma would be a plus. · Ability to adapt and perform multiple roles. · Strong work ethic and self-management skills. · Ability to work independently with minimal supervision. To apply for this offer, please send a CV and a cover letter to: recruitment@edhec-dbd.com To know more about EDHECinfra: https://edhec.infrastructure.institute/mission

solutions for discussion and execution Facilitate the evaluation and onboarding of qualified research staff, ensuring a smooth and efficient recruitment process Supervise the research administration team to ensure all key deadlines are met and all research administration process adhere to relevant guidelines  Research Administration  Provide administrative leadership and support to academic staff on grant management and administration Oversee administrative matters pertaining to the department’s research projects Advise department researchers on institutional and local guidelines regarding in research administration processes, including ethics approvals, research agreements Resourceful and capable of managing complex situations Excellent organisational and project management skills Guardian has evolved from its pharmacy roots to a holistic one-stop solution for customers’ health and beauty needs. Company Name: THE EDGE CONTRACTING SERVICES PTE. LTD.
Job Description: IT Business Analyst (1-Year Contract, Renewable Annually) We are seeking a skilled IT Business Analyst for a 1-year contract to join our consultancy team and collaborate on delivering cutting-edge IT solutions. The successful candidate will play a key role in managing projects, aligning IT strategies with the client's business goals, and ensuring seamless execution across teams. The contract is renewable yearly, offering the opportunity for continued engagement.  Key Responsibilities:  Communicate regularly and work closely with business units to ensure alignment on projects and overall service delivery. Contribute to IT projects by ensuring they are delivered on time, within budget, and adhering to internal processes and standards, including IT security protocols and SDLC frameworks. Participate in all phases of the project lifecycle, including requirements gathering, design discussions, SIT, UAT, user training, and maintaining comprehensive project documentation. Collaborate with software architects, vendors, team members, and business stakeholders to coordinate efforts and deliver projects efficiently. Identify, manage, and resolve complex issues while proactively preventing escalations. Stay updated on emerging trends, industry disruptions, and innovative technologies to support and enhance business objectives.  Key Requirements:  Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a related discipline. 4-5 years of technology experience with strong business analysis skills. Familiarity with how hospitality systems integrate to deliver seamless customer experiences. Knowledge of creating tender documents, evaluating tenders, and managing contracting processes is advantageous. Proven ability to facilitate business users in defining problem statements, articulating business outcomes, and driving process re-engineering or business transformation. Ability to adapt to shifting priorities, ambiguity, and multiple demands in a fast-paced environment. Experience in managing projects using agile methodologies is preferred. This is a 1-year contract to start, renewable yearly.   Why Join Us? As part of our consultancy, you’ll have the opportunity to work on impactful projects for leading enterprises. This 1-year contract role provides you with the flexibility to work on high-impact projects while enhancing your skill set and contributing to the delivery of high-quality IT solutions. The contract is renewable annually, offering the possibility of continued work and growth.

Civil Engineer (Civil Construction) (LTA project experience required)  5.5 days work day at East area  Primary Roles  Plan, prioritize and manage assigned projects, involved in the areas of pre-planning, budgeting, resources allocation, contract negotiation, drawings submission, progress claim, and worker coordination, to ensure that the team’s resources are used effectively and project deadlines are met. Supervise construction site personnel and subcontractors, client & consultant, attend weekly project progress meetings, and monitor compliance with building and safety codes and regulations. Ensuring the timely, budget control, and cost-effective completion of construction projects.  Key activities Project Planning Responsible for creating a comprehensive project plan that outlines the project's objectives, scope, deliverables, timeline, and resource requirements. They collaborate with stakeholders to define project goals and develop a roadmap for project execution.  Risk Management Identify potential risks and develop strategies to mitigate them. Conduct risk assessments, create risk management plans, and implement risk response strategies to minimize the impact of risks on project outcomes.  Schedule Management Develop project schedules, defining tasks, dependencies, and timelines. Monitor progress, track milestones, and identify any deviations from the planned schedule. If necessary, adjust keep the project on track.  Quality Assurance Ensure that project deliverables meet the required quality standards. Define quality criteria, establish quality control processes, and conduct regular inspections and reviews to monitor and improve the project's quality.  Reporting and Documentation Responsible for generating regular progress reports and status updates for stakeholders. Document project activities, decisions, and outcomes to create a comprehensive project record.  Stakeholder Management Identify project stakeholders and establish effective communication channels with them. Engage stakeholders throughout the project, manage their expectations, and address any concerns or issues that may arise.  Change Management Handle changes that occur during the project lifecycle. Assess change requests, evaluate their impact on the project's scope, timeline, and budget, and implement appropriate change management procedures.  Continuous Improvement Evaluate project performance and conduct lessons learned sessions to identify areas for improvement. Use feedback and insights gained from completed projects to enhance project management processes and practices within the organization.  Requirements: Minimum a Bachelor's Degree in Civil Engineering with PE Board recognized Minimum 4 years construction experiences in Singapore especially in Civil & Infrastructure works Knowledge in project management methodologies Good organization & Time Management Strong Analytical & problem-solving abilities Adaptability and Flexibility

Job Title: Electrical Engineer (Electrical System; Testing , Inspection, Troubleshooting)
Job Description: Role: Electrical Engineer Permanent Position Location: Central, Singapore  Perform daily, weekly, and monthly maintenance on the PBT system, including testing, inspection, adjustment, and calibration tasks, both at heights and within equipment enclosures. Maintain, test, and troubleshoot key systems, including:Accelerator systems Irradiation devices, Patient alignment systems, Safety interlock systems Monitor the operation of the PBT system and identify areas for performance improvement. Adopt and integrate new technology, products, and processes to enhance system functionality. Respond promptly to service calls, ensuring timely resolution and customer satisfaction. Fulfill work orders, submit reports (including timecards, working reports, and expense reports), and adhere to company  and customer procedures. Assist with troubleshooting and commissioning activities when necessary. Ensure compliance with regulatory standards, including radiation safety regulations, company policies, and applicable laws. Work with high-voltage equipment, magnetic  fields, and in radiation-prone environments. Rotating shift work is required.  Requirements:  Diploma or higher in Electrical Engineering or a related discipline. 3+ years of relevant experience with large-scale electrical systems. Strong understanding of electrical systems, particularly in environments involving high-voltage, radiation, and electromagnetic fields. Proficient in reading and interpreting engineering documents (e.g., schematics, circuit diagrams, piping diagrams). Experience using electronic test and measurement instruments such as DVM, oscilloscopes, and micrometers. Capable of working independently as well as collaboratively within cross-functional teams. Excellent communication, problem-solving skills,  and attention to detail. Ability to understand and troubleshoot complex equipment and systems. Familiarity with Microsoft Word and Excel. Comfortable with working at heights and lifting up to 20 kg repeatedly. A customer-focused mindset with a strong sense of teamwork.  Salary Budget: SGD 4000 to 4700 (based on experience and qualifications)

Job Description: JOB SUMMARY / JOB OVERVIEW:  The Marketing Manager is responsible for managing activities to create, communicate, deliver, and exchange offerings that have value for customers, clients, partners, and other stakeholders that the company considers as important to achieve business goals. He/She utilises marketing as well as market research and analysis to drive the formulation of marketing strategy and planning.   He/She plans and oversees a broad range of initiatives including product and business service launches, advertising, email efforts, events, and social media communications. The Marketing Manager oversees the production of all promotional materials and marketing campaigns.   DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:   Formulates and proposes to the higher-level echelon marketing and communication strategies, both offline and online, in line with the company’s overall corporate strategy Delivers content consistent with approved marketing strategies at a fashion that is accurate, professional, and timely  Conducts an analysis of the effectiveness of marketing campaigns Interviews, hires, and trains marketing staff members Establishes marketing goals based on past performance and market forecasts Oversees current offerings and comes up with initiatives for new products or services Researches and analyses market trends, demographics, pricing schedules, competitor products, and other relevant information to form marketing strategies Works with the marketing staff to develop detailed marketing plans for all media channels and sales teams Oversees the creative development of promotional materials, website content, advertisements, and other marketing-related projects Communicates with various media buyers, advertising agencies, printers, and other services to help marketing projects come to fruition Provides in-depth information to interested clients, and acts as a representative for the marketing department in important buyer meetings Works within the department budget to develop cost-effective marketing plans for each product or service Tracks all marketing and sales data and creates detailed written reports and verbal presentations to bring to senior executives Adjusts marketing campaigns and strategies as needed in response to collected data and other feedback Builds relationships with external content providers such as publishers to pursue publicity and promotional activities Plays an active role in improving the development of customer database  Assesses marketing-related material quotations and invoices and recommends to higher management the optimum pricing and quality Establishes and maintains the ideal working relationships with partner organisations, affiliates, government agencies, the press, reporters, media channels, and other public relations (PR) audiences Assists the General Manager and the higher-echelon managers with projects and/or other assignments as directed   QUALIFICATIONS:   Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Business, or related field Expert on media channels, client relationships Excellent creativity, adaptability, research, analysis, writing, public speaking, interpersonal communication Excellent leadership, people management, and detail-orientated Well-versed in marketing budgeting and organisation Copywriting skills Computer-literate - Microsoft Office, Mac, and Windows OS Multi-tasking skills
