JOB SUMMARY  We are seeking an accomplished and visionary professional to join      our team as the Head, Cross-sell & Deepening solutions delivery for      our Wealth & Retail Banking. The role is responsible for enhancing the      bank’s relationship with existing clients by driving increased engagement,      encouraging traffic across mobile and outbound channels, monetisation of      our mobile assets, and implementing targeted cross-sell strategies. This      role will focus on understanding client behaviours, designing initiatives      to enhance touchpoints, and using data-driven strategies to increase the      depth and breadth of client relationships. The ideal candidate will      collaborate with Digital sales, Product, Segment, Marketing, and Analytics      teams to maximize client traffic and lifetime value.  RESPONSIBILITIES Strategy & Thought Leadership  Execution of Cross-Sell portfolio plans, such as design and execute      cross-sell strategies for existing clients to offer additional relevant      products and services. Identify product and service needs across segments      to increase wallet share and deepen client relationships. Develop Traffic-Driving Initiatives across owned channels (mobile,      web, and outbound) focussing on improving client engagement, driving      sales, and creating awareness of our product offerings.  Collaborate      with the Journey and Experience optimization team to design mobile-first      use cases that drive clients to the mobile app, enhancing engagement rates      and ensuring clients find value in using the app regularly. Continue optimization of live use cases to drive higher conversion      by periodically refining messaging, optimizing workflows, and making      necessary adjustments to improve conversion rates and overall      performance. Optimise mobile assets through configuring various mobile app slots      (e.g., banners, push notifications, in-app messages) to showcase      personalized offers. Strategically place these slots based on client      behavior, segment, and preferences to increase visibility and      engagement. Incorporate Pricing capability in Decisioning: Utilize dynamic      pricing models and decisioning logic to deliver personalized,      price-optimized offers by integrating pricing capability within      decisioning frameworks Data Ingestion & Integration: Design, develop, and maintain      automated data ingestion pipelines for seamless integration of static,      derived and derived and aggregated attributes for use case delivery.      Implement data validation processes to ensure high-quality, accurate, and      consistent data ingestion, handling any discrepancies or inconsistencies      across data sources. Optimize data ingestion pipelines for speed,      reliability, and scalability to ensure they can handle increasing data      volume and complexity as the business grows. Improve decisioning to monetise our existing capabilities through      leverage advanced decisioning models and arbitration logic to refine how      clients are targeted and served. Enhance workflows to ensure that product      offerings are tailored, timely, and personalized, maximizing their appeal      and relevance to drive traffic and increase conversions across      channels. Establishing critical OKRs for Traffic and Engagement and measure      campaign effectiveness with the use of analytics to generate actionable      insights, optimize campaign performance, and iterate on strategies to      drive higher traffic and engagement. Drive a culture of continuous improvement and innovation to keep      the retail bank at the forefront of marketing technology advancements.  Collaboration & Stakeholder Management  Foster strong cross-functional collaboration      with marketing teams, IT, compliance, and other relevant stakeholders to      ensure successful implementation of sales and engagement initiatives. Act as a key liaison between the cross-sell and engagement team and      senior management, providing regular updates on progress and strategic      insights.  People & Talent  Engage critical regional, global and      functional stakeholders in the delivery of the Digital Sales &      Distribution agenda and ensure strong alignment and sponsorship amongst      peers and leaders. Collaborate with the Digital Sales and Marketing center of      expertise as well as country digital heads to define capability's      introduction and enhancement roadmap in line with strategies and      priorities. Establish a performance, collaborative and customer centric culture      while ensuring execution certainty. Strengthen talent pool to support Digital Sales and engagement      agenda  Risk Management  Responsible for identifying, assessing, monitoring, controlling and      mitigating risks to the Group. Create, enhance, and drive awareness and understanding of the main      risks facing the Group and the role the individual plays in managing them. Interprets relevant data and identifies key issues based on this      information and put in place appropriate controls and measures. Ensure activities comply with relevant compliance, and security      standards.  Governance  Responsible for assessing the effectiveness of the Group’s      arrangements to deliver effective governance, oversight, and controls in      the business and, if necessary, oversee changes in these areas. Awareness and understanding of the regulatory framework, in which      the Group operates, and the regulatory requirements and expectations      relevant to the role. Responsible for delivering ‘effective governance’; capability to      challenge fellow executives effectively; and willingness to work with any      local regulators in an open and cooperative manner.  Regulatory & Business Conduct  Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group’s Values and Code      of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of      ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard      Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with,      in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the      Group Code of Conduct. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and      resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.  Key Stakeholders  Regional and Country Heads of CPBB (Consumer, Private and Business      Banking) Group and Country Personal Banking teams, Affluent Banking teams,      Wealth Management teams, Digital teams, and Product teams Group Digital Management team, CPBB Global Head, Digital Sales & Marketing Domain Leads and respective Hive Leads, CPBB Global Head Data and Analytics and team, CPBB Support Functions - Retail Operational Risk, Retail Banking CFCC,      ITO, Finance, GIA etc  Our Ideal Candidate  Master’s degree in marketing, Business administration or computer      science. 15 plus years experience in banking, client engagement, digital      marketing, or a similar role with a focus on cross-sell, deepening, and      traffic-driving initiatives. Experience in international and multicultural environment. Strong leadership skills with experience of managing large team in      complex environment. Experience in interacting with diverse stakeholders including      technology, risk and compliance area. Strong customer centric focus with decent understanding of product      propositions and customer journey design. Demonstrated strategic thinking and strong analytical skills in      combination with innovative thinking. Strong Communication and interpersonal skills. Execution focus and ability to move from details to vision Experience in agile delivery and design thinking methodology      understanding  Role Specific Technical Skills  Energy and a desire to succeed; follows through on commitments;      pushes self and others to deliver exceptional results. Business leadership – able to provide digital and customer      leadership and expertise to Regional and Country managers. Excellent people leadership and talent development skills. Relationship building & influencing – able to build strong      relationships across internal and external stakeholders. Your new company  Our client is one of the leading global players in the Construction and Infrastructure sector. They offer a wide range of innovative solutions, with a strong focus on delivering complex, large-scale projects globally. They are undergoing expansion in recent years and are now looking to expand their headcount with a Construction Manager. Your new role  A few of your responsibilities would be; · Oversee station construction operations. · Plan and coordinate subcontractors, suppliers, materials, and equipment to meet project timelines and budgets. · Monitor project progress, control material usage, and minimize wastage. · Conduct daily team meetings, site walks, and progress reporting. · Collaborate with technical, contracts, design, quality, and EHS teams to ensure project delivery. · Manage traffic diversions, underground services, and temporary works. · Ensure timely requisition of resources and resolution of quality and safety issues. What you'll need to succeed · Degree in Civil Engineering or a related field, complemented by a strong academic record. · A minimum of 15 years of experience in the construction industry, with a focus on large-scale infrastructure projects, including at least 10 years of experience in MRT projects. · Completion of all required training certifications for Construction Managers, ensuring expertise in safety protocols, quality management, and regulatory compliance. · Location: East of Singapore. What you'll get in return  You'll be offered career development opportunities, succession planning and on the job training will definitely be given to you. You’d also have an amazing team supporting you throughout your career.  What you need to do now If you feel like you meet the above requirements or know someone who does, then click on the link to apply, or, you may send your application/referral directly to me at aloysius.loh@hays.com.sg. Job Title: Global Head - Change Delivery & Enablement, WRB
Job Description: JOB SUMMARY  Wealth      and Retail Banking (WRB) aims to become the leading Cross-Border Affluent      Bank and Wealth Manager, through strengthening our Affluent continuum,      unlock network value via International Banking, accelerate Private Banking      growth, and future proof our business with strong focus on risk, talent,      underpinned by scalable digital platform and operational capabilities. WRB      business will invest to expand our wealth solutions and upgrade advisory      capabilities, tailor our international propositions, enhance our frontline      enablers to support our growth in relationship managers, and strengthen      our support functions in line with our growth aspirations. The      Global Head, Change Delivery & Enablement, WRB will support the Global      Head of Digital, in partnership with key WRB business stakeholders, COO      and CIO to lead an integrated approach that enables and continuously      optimise delivery of WRB investment agenda, ensuring that we maximise      return on investment with clear traceability to business outcomes, drive      transparency on investment allocation and associated capacity, and      execution certainty. This will require improving our business agility of      One Delivery team to be quick to adapt in volatile, uncertain, complex,      ambiguous (VUCA) environment, and respond rapidly and flexibly to client      needs.  RESPONSIBILITIES Strategy  Play      a key role in establishing annual investment agenda, budgeting process and      capacity planning for circa annual budget of $400M, and delivery capacity      of ~4000 Be      the challenger and drive WRB investment agenda to be client-centric and      risk aware, reflective of our balanced scorecard that ultimately increases      shareholder value Optimise      shape of investment that balances between supporting growth, regulatory      compliance, risk remediation (in line with our risk appetite), and      operational efficiency Partner      with One Delivery leadership to develop and execute business aligned      investment agenda across WRB in consultation with WRB Management Team,      COO, CIO, and key functional partners (Risk, Compliance, Finance)  Business  Establish      Change Delivery ‘single source of truth’ system for Outcome, Demand and      Supply Work      with One Delivery leadership and Transformation team to develop, define      and track consistent delivery metrics, aligned with internal and external      benchmarks Partner      with Transformation team and One Delivery leadership to define and embed      clear Roles and Responsibilities for critical roles such as outcome      owners, domain/sub-domain leads (both business and technology), product      owners, engineering lead, test lead, chapter lead, etc Data-driven      performance management monitoring and cadence leveraging single source of      truth system for Change Delivery Define      and maintain a consistent set of methodologies for initiative impact      valuation and tracking that resonate with WRB Management Team and wider      senior leaders Partner      with group transformation team and One Delivery leadership team in design      and implementation of ways of working, uplift operational and people      capabilities and drive efficiencies Drive      adoption of continuous improvement and agile best practices, mindsets and      capabilities across One Delivery team, and group/country stakeholders Work      with One Delivery leadership to translate long-term vision and digital      innovation roadmap into either distinct programmes or iterative agile      deliverables Champion      leadership and cultural behaviour of what good looks like in Change      Delivery Establish      regular cadence that facilitate constructive debate and discussion on what      good looks like for e2e delivery community (business, technology,      operations) Continuously      strive for optimal empowerment with appropriate accountability, streamline      decision making/prioritisation process  Processes  Evolve      budget-led to capacity-led planning process, drive robust prioritisation      discussion keeping in mind intended key outcomes and capacity constraint      (if any) Refine      and embed discipline in backlog management best practice with clear      entry/exit criteria across backlog lifecycle​​​​​​​ Ensure      appropriate planning, governance and controls are in place and deliver      benefits from investments per commitment (Corporate Plan, Scorecard,      Regulations, Risk Treatment Plans, Audit) via strong collaboration with      the broader WRB business as well as COO, CIO and functions Proactively      propose and design control improvements, enhancements, and simplifications      where appropriate Proactively      monitor change deliverables’ artefacts and deliverables for quality and      completeness, including auditable approval trails Partner      with WRB portfolio financial management meets its annual budget via thorough      review, control and report on financial status as per the bank’s standards Monitor      programme benefits and ensure benefits management plans are implemented      effectively with clear ownership and metrics of success Advocate      and lead by example best practices across all change deliverables within      WRB investment portfolio and heighten quality of delivery  ​​​​​​​People & Talent  Lead      and support a change in mindset, building a culture of client centricity,      agility, and accountability through standardised metrics and measurement,      ensuring everyone are drivers and owners of client outcomes. Set      effective metrics and standards, transparently communicating them to team      members, providing feedback and rewarding employees accordingly. Set the      appropriate tone and expectations for the wider team. Employ,      engage, and retain high quality people, with succession planning for      critical roles. Ensure      team structure/capacity is regularly reviewed to enable delivery of client      outcomes. Ensure      the provision of on-going training & development, ensure that direct      reports are suitably skilled and qualified for their roles and that they      have effective supervision in place to mitigate any risk.  Risk Management  Identify      weaknesses across the end-to-end process risk and control environment and      monitor rectification as required. Ensure      implementation of appropriate control systems and operational procedures      to support investment sales and securities transactions and the effective      administration of customer accounts. Ensure      adequate and appropriate systems and controls are in compliance with Group      and Business policies, procedures, standards and codes, including those      governing all Risk types, Compliance, Technology and Operations, Finance      and Reputation.  Governance  Maintain      awareness and understanding of the regulatory framework in which the Bank      operates, and the regulatory requirements and expectations relevant to the      role. Responsible      for delivering effective governance as the first line of defence and      collaborate closely with second and third line of defence to ensure well      controlled ecosystem, meeting the requisite governance standards      established within the Bank.  Regulatory & Business Conduct  Display      exemplary conduct and live by the Group’s Values and Code of Conduct. Take      personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics,      including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank.      This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and      spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of      Conduct. Effectively      and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct      and compliance matters.  Key Stakeholders  Serve      as the champion for Wealth Products and Propositions delivery across the      organization, working closely with Wealth Solutions Product team,      distribution teams, segment team, Markets and client-facing units. Collaborate      with the country product teams and client segments to ensure effective      communication, training, and support of digital enablement of wealth      platforms and services across the markets. Build      strong relationships with internal stakeholders (e.g., Wealth, compliance,      legal, risk) and external partners (e.g., custodians, platform providers,      counterparties, vendors, advisors) to ensure seamless product delivery and      integration. WRB      Segment and Product Heads WRB      Cluster Heads WRB      CIO WRB      COO WRB      Architect WRB      Digital Head One      Delivery Team Relevant      Transformation Teams – Ways of Working, Operational Excellence Relevant      Functions in Risk, Compliance, Finance, Legal & HR Programme/Project      Accountable Executives and Managers  Our Ideal Candidate  15+      years of experience in wealth management, investment products, and      propositions. 7      + years in a senior leadership or global role. Proven      track record in delivering large scale and complex changes, and embedding      best practice Experience      working with cross-functional teams in a global and complex organization. Strong      track record of large, complex business-technology delivery projects Understand      core business processes and associated technical solutions Proven      ability to provide guidance and execute in an agile way through teams      across geographic locations. Bachelor’s      degree in finance, business, economics, or a related field (MBA or      equivalent advanced degree preferred). Relevant      professional qualifications (e.g., CSPO/CSM/Agile Leadership/PMP) are a      plus  Role specific technical Competencies:  Strong      leadership and team management skills with the ability to motivate,      mentor, and develop talent. Strategic      thinker with the ability to translate global trends and market insights      into actionable product strategies. Excellent      connected listening skills to establish strong understanding and trusted      relationship with key stakeholders In-depth      knowledge of change delivery best practice with strong ability to manage      ambiguity  About Standard Chartered We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 170 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. If you're looking for a career with purpose and you want to work for a bank making a difference, we want to hear from you. You can count on us to celebrate your unique talents and we can't wait to see the talents you can bring us. Our purpose, to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, together with our brand promise, to be here for good are achieved by how we each live our valued behaviours. When you work with us, you'll see how we value difference and advocate inclusion. Together we:  Do      the right thing and      are assertive, challenge one another, and live with integrity, while      putting the client at the heart of what we do Never      settle, continuously      striving to improve and innovate, keeping things simple and learning from      doing well, and not so well Are      better together, we      can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work      collectively to build for the long term  What we offer In line with our Fair Pay Charter, we offer a competitive salary and benefits to support your mental, physical, financial and social wellbeing.  Core      bank funding for retirement savings, medical and life insurance, with      flexible and voluntary benefits available in some locations. Time-off including      annual leave, parental/maternity (20 weeks), sabbatical (12 months      maximum) and volunteering leave (3 days), along with minimum global      standards for annual and public holiday, which is combined to 30 days      minimum. Flexible      working options      based around home and office locations, with flexible working patterns. Proactive      wellbeing support through Unmind, a market-leading digital      wellbeing platform, development courses for resilience and other human      skills, global Employee Assistance Programme, sick leave, mental      health first-aiders and all sorts of self-help toolkits A      continuous learning culture to support your growth, with      opportunities to reskill and upskill and access to physical, virtual and      digital learning. Being      part of an inclusive and values driven organisation, one that      embraces and celebrates our unique diversity, across our teams, business      functions and geographies - everyone feels respected and can realise their      full potential. Job Title: Director, Business Continuity and Operational Resilience, CIB Coverage
Job Description: JOB SUMMARY  The CIB Coverage COO team works with the CIB Coverage department to      maximize the performance of the CIB Coverage business, partnering with the      functions and geographies. The Client Coverage COO Conduct and Control      team focuses on aspects of business risk management with particular      emphasis on (i) Conduct and Culture (ii) Non-financial risk management and      (iii) Governance.  This is executed through activities like leading      the CIB Coverage Non-financial risk committee (NFRC), Group Conduct forum      and working with the functions to ensure effective risk governance,      building  the foundations for future growth.  As such the Director, Business Continuity and Operational Resilience, CIB Coverage  will:  Drive, implement and execute Group process owner responsibilities      (GPO) for CIB Coverage Business Resilience and Third-Party Risk Management      (TPRM) as a delegate. Act as a main point of contact for CIB Coverage Operational      resilience, Business continuity, Crisis management, Operational continuity      in resolution (OCIR)  and TPRM matters, managing stakeholders across      other CIB process/product owners (first line) and Risk Framework owners      (second line). Support Resilience and TPRM initiatives and capabilities to meet      internal and regulatory guidelines on related Group Resilience and TPRM      framework, policies and standards. Co-ordinate and involve in Operational resilience      initiatives/working groups/forum through collaboration with stakeholders      to meet resilience regulation and CIB-wide priorities. Ensure the end-to-end Operational Resilience and TPRM governance of      CIB Coverage COO processes. Support the Coverage Product Owners in development of Coverage      system capabilities both from  Technology and Business resilience      lens  to ensure that effective operational controls, processes and      systems are in place and adhered to. Support the Product Owners to address critical vulnerabilities to      relevant business services and are appropriately prioritized in the      relevant QPR. Collaborate with other Business teams to ensure critical      dependencies outside CIB Coverage are appropriately prioritized and      covered in the relevant CIB workstreams. Manage the relevant risk treatment plan, enhance controls with new      regulatory requirements to mitigate risks and escalate risks related to      Operational resilience and TPRM, where required. Support the Head, Conduct, NFR and Governance, CIB Coverage in      other non-financial risk responsibilities, activities and initiatives,      where required. Support the TPRM optimization agenda pan CIB to ensure that any      gaps against the standards are highlighted and addressed across all      third-party types. Create and oversee third party dashboards for Coverage and be able      to extract meaningful inputs across Coverage business, Ops and technology. Have a good understanding of the Supply Chain Management (SCM)      process on SCBuy, Intra Group Arrangements (IGA) and Non-vendor process on      Redux and be able to provide insights on the journey to the TOM.  RESPONSIBILITIES Strategy  Support the holistic Resilience and TPRM governance framework for      CIB Coverage, through understanding Coverage’s strategy, the flow of      reporting information within Coverage COO and understanding the      delegations of authority / stakeholder landscape for Coverage. Provide oversight of Resilience, TPRM and other non-financial      (Operational, Compliance and Conduct) risk matters within Coverage to      ensure appropriate information is consolidated on an ongoing basis, to      support effective conduct risk management practices. Act as main point of contact for all Coverage-related Resilience      and TPRM governance & issues. Work closely with CIB Resilience/TPRM leads and other CIB Business      Segment Leads across Markets, Transaction Banking etc., in the roll out of      pan-CIB actions/initiatives to establish and maintain a robust risk      framework within CIB. Manage and maintain the Group Resilience, TPRM and relevant      non-financial Risk Registers, in accordance with the requirements      specified in the relevant Group policy/frameworks/standards and prudential      regulations.  Processes / Process Owner (where applicable)  Support the GPO for Coverage Operational Resilience and TPRM in the      implementation of Group policies standards, Group and Local regulatory      requirements through prioritisation within applicable Programmes and      subsequent execution by relevant squads. Establish and execute TPRM responsibilities through a risk and      control framework relating to non-vendors risks, identified issues for      appraisers, Exit management plans for vendor arrangements. Support TPRM change and existing initiatives, with the aim of uplifting,      including valuers/appraisers’ approach, Redux cleanup, Intra-Group      arrangements remediation etc. Assess the risk materiality and impact (Inherent and residual      risks) arising from Resilience and TPRM and draft risk treatment plans,      where risks are elevated. Perform end-to-end GPO responsibilities like Risk and Control      self-assessments (RCSA), monitoring of control environment, ensuring the      controls are effective through designing and maintaining of their      outcomes. Recommend additions/enhancements/changes to the Operational      Resilience and TPRM policy, standard, guidelines, procedures, and controls      as applicable. Monitor Group Operational Resilience and TPRM risk profile within      CIB Coverage and report any heightened risks or non-compliance to the      second line. Participate and represent CIB Coverage in Operational Resilience      and TPRM working groups to provide updates and influence positive outcomes      for the Business. Support in the design and implementation of operational resilience      KRIs, KCIs and other risk ratings/assessments, as well as process designs      using available MI across CIB Coverage. Provide inputs to non-financial risk governance activities like      Top-down review and Coverage process universe refresh. Draft ad-hoc papers for noting/escalation to Coverage non-financial      risk committee (NFRC) to address any thematic or hotspots of key risk      areas.  ​​​​​​ Business  Implement bank-wide guidelines, and controls into Coverage, develop      and/or adapt training materials and templates for Group operational resilience      and TPRM to ensure effective integration into business change      processes. Ensure appropriate consultation with Cluster and Country Coverage      stakeholders though working closely with Risk and Control leads and      support functions. Help drive the Resilience and TPRM agenda and align between group      and Regional/ Country oversight. Embed new regulatory requirements and uplift existing processes on      business continuity management, crisis management, OCIR, vendor (including      Exit management plans), non-vendor, intra-group, Redux and      valuers/appraiser’s approach. Support Product Owners’ review and challenge of Important/Critical      business services and impact tolerance thresholds proposed by the      business. Identify strategic changes or vulnerabilities requiring remediation. Support the Product Owners on QPR/NFRC submissions related to      Operational risk treatment, improvement actions and monitoring of risks. Assist implementation of controls within the business to maintain      and periodically review Important/Critical business services and Impact      Tolerance thresholds as part of the business change management process. Participate in Resilience and TPRM related workshops, including      pan-CIB initiatives, exercises and scenario testing to identify      vulnerabilities in resilience of operational assets (Data, Technology,      Third party arrangement, people, property etc.)  Risk Management  Provide advice to stakeholders on information relating to Group      Resilience and TPRM risk management requirements. Support the design and implementation of monitoring in the business      to identify changes to the risk profile of operational assets such as high      criticality systems, SLAs, organisational design, movement of operational      capability. Support the Product Owners to embed group and country level      capability applicable where there is a downstream dependency of Coverage      services to respond and recover from natural disasters, market events,      external attacks and topical situations such as elections. Drive and execute Coverage Operational Resilience Response &      Recovery Plans, Crisis Management Plans, Playbooks/Runbooks and TPRM      related initiatives. Support the Group Process Owner for Coverage Client Service      Resilience where there are crisis exercises within the CIB Crisis      Management Group and support preparation for crisis exercises on a regular      basis to ensure preparedness for any contingency. Collaborate with stakeholders across the three lines of defence to      understand the current gaps in the Resilience and TPRM risk framework      across Coverage & CIB. Maintain and improve non-financial risk reporting requirements and      generate high quality papers/reports for committees and governance      forums. Highlight risks to management and actively monitor them to reduce      the likelihood of occurrence. Manage regular communication of status updates to key stakeholders      including Senior Management through presentations and reports.  ​​​​​​​Governance  Prepare and review suitability and quality of packs and dashboards      prepared and enforce high standards. Link Resilience and TPRM risk remediation and actions taken to the      wider non-financial risk profile to manage the Coverage business risks. Support the Head, Conduct, NFR and Governance, CIB Coverage in      other non-financial risk responsibilities, activities and initiatives      where required. Awareness and understanding of the Enterprise risk management      framework and good understanding of Operational risk framework. Awareness of the regulatory framework in which the Group operates,      and the regulatory requirements and expectations relevant to the role.  Regulatory & Business Conduct  Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group’s Values and Code      of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of      ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard      Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with,      in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the      Group Code of Conduct. Lead CIB Coverage to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank’s      Conduct Principles as guided by the Group Conduct risk management      standard. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate, and      resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.  Key Stakeholders  Coverage and Coverage COO MT. Cluster/Regional/Country Risk and Control Heads and Business      planning managers. First line stakeholder: Group Operational Resilience team &      Group TPRM/SCBuy/Non-Vendor/Vendor/Redux teams. Second line stakeholders: Operational Risk and Compliance. CIB Operational Resilience and TPRM Leads. NFRC Committee members. Coverage Network. Global Business Services. Global Process Owner Delegates. Group Internal Auditors, External Auditors.  Other Responsibilities  Embed Here for good and Group’s brand and values in Group Coverage      COO team. Perform other responsibilities assigned under Group, Business or      Functional policies and procedures.  Our Ideal Candidate  10+ years of relevant work experience in banking and financial      services. Relevant working experience in Business Operational Resilience and      Business Continuity, Third party risk management and Group process      owner/first line roles. Knowledge of CIB Coverage business and Credit Operations processes.      Additional knowledge of SCB’s architecture, processes and systems is an      advantage. Highly effective in communications skills both verbal and written. Highly proficient in Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word,      PowerPoint and Excel). Strong understanding of the evolving industry and regulatory      requirements and the ability to translate these into implementable      actions. Proven track record of implementing bank-wide regulatory and      business critical programs. Strong analytical skills and attention to details. Excellent problem-solving abilities and judgment. Strong understanding of banking products / processes / operations.  Role Specific Technical Competencies  Subject matter expertise in Business Operational Resilience and      Third-party risk management Technical knowledge in non-financial risk management, performing      risk assessment and initiatives for the CIB Coverage business. Knowledge of CIB Coverage business and Credit Operations processes Governance, Regulation and Risk Management - Regulatory Compliance Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and ownership of      issues Ability to make good/sound decisions and use independent judgement  About Standard Chartered We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 170 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. If you're looking for a career with purpose and you want to work for a bank making a difference, we want to hear from you. You can count on us to celebrate your unique talents and we can't wait to see the talents you can bring us. Our purpose, to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, together with our brand promise, to be here for good are achieved by how we each live our valued behaviours. When you work with us, you'll see how we value difference and advocate inclusion. Together we:  Do the right thing and      are assertive, challenge one another, and live with integrity, while      putting the client at the heart of what we do Never settle, continuously      striving to improve and innovate, keeping things simple and learning from      doing well, and not so well Are better together, we      can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work      collectively to build for the long term  What we offer In line with our Fair Pay Charter, we offer a competitive salary and benefits to support your mental, physical, financial and social wellbeing.  Core bank funding for retirement savings,      medical and life insurance, with flexible and      voluntary benefits available in some locations. Time-off including      annual leave, parental/maternity (20 weeks), sabbatical (12 months      maximum) and volunteering leave (3 days), along with minimum global      standards for annual and public holiday, which is combined to 30 days      minimum. Flexible working options      based around home and office locations, with flexible working patterns. Proactive wellbeing support through      Unmind, a market-leading digital wellbeing platform, development courses      for resilience and other human skills, global Employee Assistance      Programme, sick leave, mental health first-aiders and all sorts of      self-help toolkits A continuous learning culture to      support your growth, with opportunities to reskill and upskill and access      to physical, virtual and digital learning. Being part of an inclusive and values driven      organisation, one that embraces and celebrates our      unique diversity, across our teams, business functions and geographies -      everyone feels respected and can realise their full potential. Location: PAYA LEBAR SQUARE, 60 PAYA LEBAR ROAD 409051
Job Description: Are you passionate about driving the growth of a game through innovative marketing strategies and enhancing player engagement? Do you excel at developing data-driven marketing plans and collaborating with cross-functional teams to create standout content? Are you eager to take on the challenge of shaping the future of mobile gaming? If so, join our innovative team at OneMT as a Digital Marketing Specialist!  Job Responsibilities:  Work with the marketing team in planning, execution, and management of marketing initiatives across multiple channels to achieve performance targets. Collaborate with various departments to develop marketing campaigns, delivery plans, and incorporating marketing mix planning to enhance MROI. Utilise analytics tools to measure and optimize performance of marketing campaigns. Implement event tracking and leverage MarTech and AdTech platforms to improve ROI. Drive organic growth through ASO, SEO and other relevant strategies. Understanding of the compliance requirements for data privacy and optimization strategies for major advertising platforms. Collaborate with internal teams and external agencies on ad creatives, including video shoot, graphic design, website design, etc. Manage the creation and creatives for websites and landing pages with utilization of SEO best practices. Track industry trends and competitors’ advertising strategies and provide targeted suggestions and solutions for our campaigns Execute community building effort and live-ops in collaboration with Product.  Job Requirements:  Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Computer Science, or related field / experience. Experience in marketing for mobile games, with a track record of successful brand and advertising campaign execution, social media management, and user acquisition. Understanding of mobile game marketing and advertising on advertising platforms such as Google, Meta, and Tik Tok Strong analytical skills, with proficiency in market research, data analysis, and performance tracking to inform marketing strategy and decision-making. Adept at project management, with the ability to prioritize tasks, meet deadlines, and adapt to changing priorities in a fast-paced environment. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and external partners. Passion for gaming and deep understanding of player psychology, motivations, and cultural preferences.  If you're passionate about leading the charge in the ever-evolving landscape of mobile gaming, driving innovation, and crafting experiences that captivate players worldwide, we want you on our team. Join us at OneMT and be part of our exciting journey in crafting groundbreaking mobile games! OneMT is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in the workplace. We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits, and opportunities for professional growth and development. Join us and let's build something amazing together!

Job Title: Director, Securitised Products Trading, Credit Trading
Job Description: Job Summary Credit Trading –Securitised Products Trading (SPT) is focused on activities in the Global Structured Finance / Asset Backed Securities markets. The SPT desk is an established industry participant in trading, investing and financing Global ABS products across asset classes and capital structures. The team located in London, Hong Kong and Shanghai creates further synergies across our client network, providing customised securitised solutions for clients (investors and issuers), by leveraging on the credit solutions and origination product base. This role could be based in Singapore and Hong Kong. When you start the application process you will be presented with a drop down menu showing all countries, Please ensure that you select a country where the role is based.  Responsibilities · Help execute Securitised Products Trading specific strategies and ensure that performance objectives and revenue goals are met and RWA targets managed · Increase SCB's visibility by driving commercial, competitive pricing of securitised products for our clients · To work with DCM/Sales/RMs to identify new prospects and client opportunities · Provide sales desks with competitive pricing and product support in our endeavour to out serve · To explore new products and structures to increase the breadth and depth of the market · Collaborate and develop internal relationships by showing axes and giving market colour to sales teams and pricing guidance to DCM and Syndicate on new primary deals · Effective risk management of securitised products exposures · Providing proactive, comprehensive and timely credit analysis to TRM/Specialised Finance Risk, credit sales and clients · Spotting opportunities and providing forecasts and challenging views on markets, assets classes and issuers · Responsibility for providing daily prices of fixed and floating rate securities across multiple currencies · Preparing written market commentaries, giving details of market developments, new issue pricing levels, relevant rating agency publications etc. · Be part of a transparent and collaborative culture in which incentives are based on support of Client Income with specific performance metrics on the Bank's values. · To work in partnership with CIB relationship managers and Global Credit Trading teams across APAC, EMEA and Americas to ensure that the SPT product is value additive for clients and the bank  Our Ideal Candidate  8      years of experience in financial services Experience      originating, analysing and structuring underlying pools of collateral into      securitized products Strong      client network Knowledge      of fixed income specifically credit Prior      sell side or buy side experience  · Advanced experience in pricing of securitised products across variety of asset classes and parts of the capital structure · Advanced experience originating, analysing and structuring underlying pools of collateral into securitised products · Strong network of client base in origination and distribution for incremental business value add · Advanced experience of Excel to model granular ABS/RMBS underlying pools with securitisation tranches overlayed to perform IRR and stress testing analysis. · Experienced at setting up SPVs, structuring and legal documentation expertise · Extensive exposure and knowledge of Fixed Income specifically Credit but also Rates and FX markets · Prior sell side or buy side experience analysing, arranging, trading, structuring securitised products · Excellent communication (written and verbal) and negotiation skills · Comprehensive credit analysis using Intex/Moody’s Analytics/Bloomberg analysis and proactive monitoring of securitised exposures, identifying industry/regulatory trends and relative value between sectors, RWA optimisation using Sec SA · Advanced experience in analysing securitisation documents · Advanced understanding of credit and securitisation risks · Thorough understanding and assessment of credit risk across frontier, emerging and developed markets · In depth and expert knowledge of CRR, Basel, FRTB and other regulatory issues affecting securitisation markets · In depth knowledge of ESG and Impact investment analysis in Securitisation markets  Role Specific Technical Competencies  Trading      - Investments Trading      - Market Risk Trading      - Trading Trading      - Service Excellence Trading      - Securities Laws and Regulations (SLR) Compliance Trading      - Investment Risk Economics and Finance  About Standard Chartered We're an JOB SUMMARY  This role could be based in Singapore, Australia and UK. When you      start the application process you will be presented with a drop down menu      showing all countries, Please ensure that you select a country where the      role is based. The WRB Global Digital Sales team’s objective is to partner with      country, product, and technology stakeholders to create programs, content      and experiences that will support acquisition and engagement of prospects      and customers through SC’s Digital Assets. With a customer centric      approach, the team is focused on delivering on the customer intent through      its acquisition and deepening strategies while driving profitable      acquisitions for the business.  Personalization Manager  As Lead, you will be responsible for helping our customers discover      all Bank products, offers and services by leveraging personalization to      recommend the right product through the right channels at the right time.      Your objective is to create meaningful and memorable experiences for      customer by offering most relevant product or service to customers and      ultimately drive conversions. You will review the existing personalization      strategy and identify areas of optimization. You will then establish the      personalization playbook and propagate best practices to be adopted across      markets. You are expected to lead the personalization strategy for SC’s      Digital Assets with a good understanding of customer segmentation, data      availability, PEGA and offer / treatment approaches that will enhance the      engagement levels of our existing customers.  RESPONSIBILITIES Strategy  Shaping the overall personalization strategy, defining, and      prioritising key requirements with the Martech and business teams and      working with the markets to ensure that their plans are integrated. Review existing personalization strategy and identify areas of      optimization.  Business  Measuring the success of campaigns so as to understand the impact      of personalization and data-driven decisions Establish personalization playbook and propagate best practices to      be adopted across markets. Partner with Retail and Country Analytics team as well as the      Martech team to understand customer behaviors, data signals as well as      their channel preferences so as to define the recommendation engine’s      optimization approach . Drive new initiatives for cross-selling and upselling based on      segment-level behaviour and preferences. Assess and refine business value      and customer value of new initiatives through partnership with Martech      partners and Retail Analytics.  Processes  Develop a deep understanding of PEGA Real-Time Interaction      Management (RTIM) and Adobe Customer Data Platform (CDP) to effectively      leverage these tools in optimizing digital client journeys. Design and implement strategies to present the Next Best Action to      customers, enhancing engagement and sales conversion across channels. Continuously analyze and refine personalization tactics by      utilizing insights from PEGA RTIM, Adobe CDP and other signals from the      major platforms driving data-driven decision-making to drive higher      conversion and sales .  Regulatory & Business Conduct  Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group’s Values and Code      of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of      ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard      Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with,      in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the      Group Code of Conduct. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and      resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.  Key Stakeholders  Country Digital Sales and Marketing Teams Digital Sales and Marketing Group Retail Analytics Legal and Compliance Group DSM Hive  Other Responsibilities  Embed Here for good and Group’s brand and values in WRB; Perform      other responsibilities assigned under Group, Country, Business or      Functional policies and procedures; Multiple functions (double hats)  Our Ideal Candidate  Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Journalism or a      related field. Master’s degree preferred. 10 plus years’ experience in Martech/ personalization roles and      proven experience in personalization leadership roles, preferably in      Wealth, Banking or Financial Services industry In-depth knowledge on personalization/ martech techniques and hands      on experience in executing personalization campaigns in banking / retail /      e-commerce industry. Strong analytical skills and data-driven mindset to drive      results-oriented decisions. Good project management skills with an ability to plan, execute,      and oversee initiatives to ensure timely completion within budget, and      meeting specified interaction goals. Strong understanding of Personalization/ Martech strategies and      best practices Excellent writing, editing and proof reading skills Experience with personalization system and tools like PEGA. Strong leadership and team management skills Excellent communication and interpersonal skills  Key Competencies:  Strategic Thinking | Personalization Expertise | Customer Focus |      Martech Strategy | Analytical Skills | Leadership and Team Management |      Project Management The ideal candidate possesses a strong product management      background, experience in e-commerce or fintech, and proficiency in data      analysis and personalization technologies. Experience in RTIM PEGA and      Adobe Campaign Management tools is a Plus.  Role Specific Technical Competencies  Manage Conduct Manage Risk Business – Strategy & Business Model (SIF) Business – Market Knowledge (SIF) Business – Products & Processes Business – Manage Change Financial – Balance Sheet Management Retail Products – CASA & Credit Cards Retail Products – Mortgage and Personal Lending Retail Products – Payments Retail Products – Channel Strategy Brand – Marketing Strategies and Channels. Job Title: Managing Editor, Breaking News South Asia
Job Description: Bloomberg News is the biggest financial and business news organization in the world. We lead the way in breaking news and providing analysis on financial markets, from intraday coverage through in-depth features. We are known for our quality, accuracy and ability to deliver news investors can use. It's what keeps us inventing and re-inventing, all the time. You are a passionate, thoughtful and experienced journalist. You are energized by breaking news and always seek to put Bloomberg ahead of our competitors through quick thinking and use of the latest technology. As one of two Breaking News Managing Editors in the Asia-Pacific region, you will be responsible for three teams of editors that own the first fifteen minutes of news from a broad remit of sources, from regulatory filings to social media. Geographically, your remit will be the part of Asia comprising Southeast Asia, South Asia, Australia and New Zealand. On the one hand you're a journalist that takes a creative approach to this role, on the other you're a hands-on leader able to make split-second judgement calls based on your nuanced understanding of the news flow. Over the longer term, you will collaborate with your peer in the region, the Breaking News Managing Editor of Northeast Asia, to present a strategy and vision for improving the speed, accuracy and depth of our output in a way that also speaks to the circumstances of Asia-Pacific. You will also be assuming leadership of the team as we expand the breadth and depth of company earnings coverage. We'll trust you to:  Have a strong sense of urgency and be sensitive to the needs of real-time clients Develop a culture of pro-activeness, innovation, and being hands on Build influential relationships with leaders across News Demonstrate an understanding of short-form writing and superior editing skills Be a thoughtful, accountable and dedicated leader, determined to elevate and expand our coverage Uphold and enforce best practices to ensure constant quality Identify future newsroom leaders and help foster their development Anticipate issues that may arise, work across teams and departments to find appropriate solutions, and know when to escalate accordingly  You'll need to have:  Atleast 8 recent years of experience in financial Journalism Atleast 8 years of experience in a real-time news environment Atleast 3 years in a position directly managing journalists Experience covering business, economic or financial news as a reporter or editor Ability to remain stoic and demonstrate sound judgement in our fast-paced and dynamic news environment Demonstrated ability to break down silos, communicate across regions and organize coverage with an emphasis on collaboration Understanding of the potential and pitfalls of social media as a source of news Keen interest in innovation, openness to new ideas and an unwavering commitment to accuracy Ability to make good judgement calls on sensitive stories Proficiency in both written and spoken English Demonstrated continuous career growth within an organization Bachelor's degree or degree-equivalent qualifications  If this sounds like you: Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloomberg.com/professional Bloomberg is committed to improving the communities, cities and countries in which we work, and we support various initiatives including hiring and developing local talents. So, you'll need to have legal authorization to work full-time in Singapore, without Bloomberg sponsoring your work authorization, to be considered for this role. Why Bloomberg? We’re individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and experiences who take on big challenges and create even bigger impact through our work. We’re interested in what makes you you, and how we can create opportunities for you to channel your unique, personal energy and grow to your fullest potential. Learn more about our office and benefits: Singapore | www.bloomberg.com/singapore

Location: PAYA LEBAR SQUARE, 60 PAYA LEBAR ROAD 409051
Categorie: Advertising / Media, Information Technology, Marketing / Public Relations
Job Description: Are you passionate about steering the direction of mobile gaming experiences and driving player engagement to new heights? Do you excel at strategic planning, data analysis, and fostering partnerships and collaborations? Are you eager to take on the challenge of shaping the future of mobile gaming? Join our innovative team at OneMT as a Mobile Game Product Manager!  Job Responsibilities:  Conduct comprehensive research and analysis on market trends, user behaviors, and competitor strategies, to inform decision-making. Conduct P&L forecasting for our games and devise product strategy. Collaborate closely with game designers to shape the player experience, gameplay mechanics, game statistics, and monetization strategies, aligning product goals with player expectations. Spearhead overall attribution and tracking effort, focusing on monetization and product-level metrics, collaborate with game designers in optimizing player engagement and revenue. Manage the UX/CX design process in enhancing player experience. Drive monetization planning effort, optimizing revenue streams while maintaining a positive player experience and fair monetization practices. Lead QA and QC testing processes and Customer Support, ensuring high-quality gameplay experiences and timely resolution of player issues. Manage publishing channels such as the Apple App Store and Google Play Store, overseeing ASO effort and working with Marketing to maximize game awareness and downloads. Oversee localization efforts to adapt games for international markets. Lead the planning and execution of community building effort and live-ops in collaboration with Marketing, including in-game events, tournaments, and community engagement activities. Cultivate brand partnerships and IP collaborations in collaboration with Marketing. Manage player base and balance player segments to ensure sustainable growth and profitability.  Job Requirements:  Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Computer Science, or related field / experience. Proven experience in product management for mobile games, with a track record of successful project execution, community engagement, partner management, and live-ops. Strong analytical skills, with proficiency in market research, data analysis, and performance tracking to inform product strategy and decision-making. Excellent project management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks, meet deadlines, and adapt to changing priorities in a fast-paced environment. Knowledge of mobile game monetization, ASO best practices, localization and community management, financial forecasting and analysis. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and external partners. Passion for gaming and deep understanding of player psychology, motivations, and cultural preferences.  If you're passionate about leading the charge in the ever-evolving landscape of mobile gaming, driving innovation, and crafting experiences that captivate players worldwide, we want you on our team. Join us at OneMT and be part of our exciting journey in crafting groundbreaking mobile games!  OneMT is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in the workplace. We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits, and opportunities for professional growth and development. Join us and let's build something amazing together!

Job Description : We are seeking a dedicated staff to join our team as a Condominium Block Cleaner. Job   Description  REs shall provide standing supervision of all civil and structural works to ensure compliance with the following authorities' requirements: The  inspection of the bus depot involves the demolition and removal of the existing Pasir Panjang Distripark. Following this, the construction will take place for main depot building, dormitory and administration office. Knowledge of construction methods, materials, and safety protocols Supervise and monitoring of contractors’ work to ensure they are carried out in accordance with the provision in the contract document. To monitor the progress and assist SRE/QP on structural inspection on all Structural works according to the approved drawings issued. To review  and supervise safety, environmental and health matters. Review and comment on contractor's submissions.  Job   Requirements  The RE  shall have minimum three (4) years of experience as a civil engineer;  and have least two (2) years shall be in supervision of works similar in  nature to the Works in the Civil Contract. All RE shall have a diploma in the civil discipline or equivalent and be accredited by JAC of IES/ACES as QSS.  Work During Office hour  Monday to   Friday: 8:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Saturday:   8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. (Willing to work on rotation shifts) Sunday and   Public Holiday: 00:00 hours onwards or otherwise advised by project officer depending on LTA’s contractor work schedule.

Job Summary The CIB Coverage COO KYC Policy Implementation (PI) team manages the implementation of Group and local KYC requirements for CIB originating from CFCC and applied by the First Line community of local/regional Business teams, Client Management Teams (CMT) and Delivery Operations. The Team also actively supports the design and development of the target state KYC processes under the current Transformation programme. We operate an end-to-end accountability model where each team member takes charge of the entire policy implementation process, from initial consultation to delivery and warranty. Similarly, team members own the entirety of specific Transformation initiatives. This is a role for individuals with a strong sense of achievement and willing to learn and apply a wide array of skills across a broad range of stakeholders. Your new company  Our client is a renowned global construction leader, renowned for delivering landmark infrastructure projects across transportation, energy, and urban development sectors. To support their expanding operations, they seek an experienced Site Engineer/Senior Site Engineer to drive innovation, foster collaboration, and enhance project delivery. Your new role  A few of your responsibilities would be; · Assist the Construction Manager in project planning, scheduling, and progress tracking. · Monitor daily site progress, identify potential delays, and implement adjustments to keep projects on track. · Maintain and update project schedules, collecting actual data on progress and manpower allocation. · Prepare monthly progress reports for internal and external stakeholders. · Collaborate with project teams to identify potential risks and develop contingency plans. · Resolve site-related technical problems and coordinate with stakeholders to resolve discrepancies. What you'll need to succeed · Minimum 8 years of engineering experience with a Degree in Civil Engineering or relevant field. · At least 3 years of experience in planning, coordinating, and managing construction works/teams on similar projects. · Prior experience working on construction sites, especially on civil projects. What you'll get in return  You'll be offered career development opportunities, succession planning and on the job training will definitely be given to you. You’d also have an amazing team supporting you throughout your career.  What you need to do now If you feel like you meet the above requirements or know someone who does, then click on the link to apply, or, you may send your application/referral directly to me at aloysius.loh@hays.com.sg. Job Title: Assistant Manager  /  Senior officer (Organizational Risk Management)
Job Description: [Job ID: 766341] Responsibilities:  Own and oversee the Organizational Risk Management processes to highlight potential high-risk areas for management attention.  Outsourcing, New Product/Business Check:   Review outsourcing and third-party management documents (e.g., policies, procedures, manuals, outsourcing registers) to ensure compliance with MAS Outsourcing Notice, Guidelines, and related documents. Ensure and support the outsourcing process and framework are compliant with MAS Outsourcing Guidelines, including consolidating outsourcing reports for MAS submission. Assist other departments with new and periodic third-party management reviews. Support the setup of the New Product Committee to study and review new products or businesses.   Business Continuity Management (BCM):   Review and maintain the BCM framework to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements. Control, facilitate, and consolidate Business Impact Analysis (BIA) and Business Continuity Plan (BCP) results from business units. Plan, coordinate, and conduct BCP tests, including call tree exercises.  Organizational & Operational Risk Management:   Develop, review, and maintain risk management tools to conduct necessary assessments. Enhance the effectiveness of the existing Organizational Risk Management framework. Control, facilitate, and consolidate the Organizational Risk Register to report to senior management. Provide key support in completing Residual Risk Assessments, collaborating with business units to identify risks and controls, evaluate inherent and residual risks, and establish mitigation plans. Identify and assess key operational risk areas and control gaps, working with business units to mitigate risks and improve controls as needed. Organize and facilitate Risk Committees and Operational Risk Committees in the risk assessment process, ensuring action plans are in place to address key risks.  Branch Self Audit (BSA), Control Self-Assessment (CSA), Branch Manual List:   Manage Branch Self Audit processes. Oversee the Control Self-Assessment Framework/activities and report to Head Office (HO). Ensure that policies, practice guides, and procedures are regularly reviewed and updated.  Environmental Risk Management (EnRM):   Maintain and develop a framework to manage environmental risks, ensuring compliance with regulatory expectations in collaboration with relevant departments.  Requirements:  Minimum 4 years of relevant experience, particularly hands-on experience in outsourcing and BCP management, within organizational/operational risk management in financial institutions. Strong communication skills to engage stakeholders and escalate issues to management in a timely manner for resolution. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel. Basic understanding of financial markets and risk processes (from risk reporting to post-approval monitoring). Good knowledge of risk management processes and experience implementing process controls.   We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. However, rest assured that all applications will be updated to our resume bank for future opportunities. Your new company  Our client is a renowned global construction leader, renowned for delivering landmark infrastructure projects across transportation, energy, and urban development sectors. To support their expanding operations, they seek an experienced BIM Manager/Coordinator to drive digital innovation, foster collaboration, and enhance project delivery. Your new role  A few of your responsibilities would be; · Prepare detailed 3D drawings using AutoCAD, Autodesk Revit MEP, and other design modeling software. · Develop and implement BIM capabilities for architecture, structures, MEP, 4D scheduling, clash detection, and construction planning. · Assist in implementing and developing BIM within the Planning and Engineering Section. · Develop and implement in-house modeling rules and regulations. · Collaborate with clients, consultants, suppliers, and internal teams on BIM implementation. · Review architectural plans and designs to ensure adherence to specifications and standards. What you'll need to succeed · Bachelor's degree or diploma in Civil Engineering, Architecture, Mechanical Engineering, or Building Services Engineering. · At least 5 years of experience in design engineering, construction engineering, or Integrated Digital Delivery (IDD) project management. · Minimum 2 years of BIM process experience. · Proficiency in BIM software such as Navisworks Manage, Solibri Office, VRCollab, or Navigator is advantageous. Job Description:  Financial Accounting, FP&A, and Cash Management for the Singapore Subsidiary  Oversee all aspects of financial accounting, forecasting, budgeting, and financial planning for the Singapore entity. Ensure accuracy and timeliness in financial reporting and cash flow management.  Store Sales Data Analysis and Sales Management for the Singapore Subsidiary  Analyze sales performance data, prepare sales forecasts, and provide insights to optimize revenue and operational efficiency. Collaborate with the sales and operations teams to manage performance and enhance sales strategies.  Monitoring and Improvement Support for Financial and Accounting Operations in Southeast Asia and India  Support and monitor the financial and accounting processes across subsidiaries in Southeast Asia and India, ensuring compliance with local regulations and company policies. Assist with process improvement initiatives and provide recommendations for efficiency gains.  Promotion of the New Accounting ERP System Implementation Project Across Southeast Asia  Lead the deployment of a new ERP system within Southeast Asia subsidiaries, ensuring smooth implementation and effective adoption. Provide training and support to local teams to ensure successful system integration.  Support for CFO Operations Across Southeast Asia  Assist the CFO in overseeing financial operations across the region, including budgeting, forecasting, financial analysis, and strategic planning. Help to ensure alignment with the organization’s broader financial goals and objectives.  Handling of Other Special CFO Tasks  Take on ad-hoc CFO-related assignments, such as financial analysis, investment evaluations, and other strategic finance projects as needed.  Reporting to the Japanese HQ  Provide regular financial reporting and updates to the Japanese headquarters. Ensure that all reports are accurate, complete, and delivered on time.  Requirements:  Fluent Japanese language proficiency (both written and spoken) Experience in financial planning, analysis, or accounting Experience in financial operations, forecasting, budgeting, and reporting is highly desirable, particularly in multinational organizations. Strong analytical skills and attention to detail Ability to analyze financial data, identify trends, and make recommendations for improvement. Proficiency in Microsoft Office and financial software/ERP systems Excellent communication skills Experience in multinational or regional financial operations

Job Description:  Quality Management System Maintenance: Ensure the organization’s Quality Management System (QMS) complies with regulatory requirements, including MOH Healthcare Services Act and relevant regulations specific to the company’s services and products. Maintain and ensure compliance with accreditation and certification standards such as AABB (Association for the Advancement of Blood & Biotherapies), FACT (Foundation for the Accreditation of Cellular Therapy), and GDP-MDS SS 620 (Good Distribution Practice for Medical Devices), among others.  Regulatory and Accreditation Compliance:Implement and maintain the necessary requirements for AABB, FACT, and MOH license guidelines. Assist in managing deviations and non-conformances (CAPA), including root cause analysis, corrective actions, and process improvement.  Auditing and Compliance:Conduct internal audits and record checks to ensure ongoing compliance with regulatory and accreditation standards. Provide support for external audits as necessary.  Document Control System:Manage the Document Control system for the organization, ensuring the proper use of controlled and approved documents by all staff.  Supplier and Vendor Management:Support supplier/vendor qualification processes and conduct audits as required.  Change Control and Quality Monitoring:Assist in managing change control activities across the organization. Monitor and review quality indicators and quality control reports across various departments to ensure continual improvement and adherence to quality standards.   Requirements:  Educational Background:Degree in a relevant field with at least 3 years of experience in Quality Systems, preferably within the healthcare, bio/pharma, health services, or biotechnology/biotherapies industry.  Skills and Competencies:Strong communication skills with the ability to convey information clearly. Team player with excellent coordination skills. Meticulous, analytical, and systematic in approach to tasks. Experience in Quality Assurance within regulated industries is highly valued.  Additional Consideration:Candidates with more extensive experience may be considered for the Assistant Manager role. Job   Description  RTOs shall  provide standing supervision of all civil and structural works to ensure compliance with the following authorities' requirements: The inspection of the bus depot involves the demolition and removal of the existing Pasir Panjang Distripark. Following this, the construction will take place for main depot building, dormitory and administration office. Supervise  and monitoring of contractors’ work to ensure they are carried out in accordance with the provision in the contract document. To monitor the progress and assist Resident Engineer on structural inspection on all Structural works according to the approved drawings issued. Reject  poor quality of works at site and inform RE to raise non-conformance notice. To ensure all building works are carried out in accordance to the design and specifications as specified in the terms of contract. Liaise with contractors in the coordination of site work Ensure contractors maintain work safety and housekeeping of the site. Checking of all drawings, specifications and schedule of works at site. Monitor and report progress of the works on site Undertake any other duties related to the project assigned.  Job   Requirements  The RTO shall have minimum three (3) years of relevant experience in projects similar in nature to the Works in the Civil Contract.
